additional_rules.name: Warlord of Carn Dum
additional_rules.description: Friendly Carn Dum models within 6" of Aldrac must re-roll failed Courage Tests.

additional_rules.name: Battle Frenzy
additional_rules.description: If Aldrac slays an enemy model that he was Engaged in Combat with, then in the following turn Aldrac may declare a Heroic Combat for free.

additional_rules.name: Remnants of Arnor
additional_rules.description: Friendly Dunedain models treat Aranarth as a banner. Additionally, all Dunedain models in the same Army List as Aranarth gain the Arnor Keyword.

additional_rules.name: Chieftain of the Dunedain
additional_rules.description: Friendly Dunedain Hero models may benefit from Arathorn's Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: The King in the North
additional_rules.description: The range of Arvedui's Stand Fast is 12", rather than 6"

additional_rules.name: Lead by Example
additional_rules.description: If Buhrdur slays an enemy Hero or Monster in Combat, then for the rest of the game other friendly Orc or Troll models treat Buhrdur as a banner. If Buhrdur has slain 3 or more enemy Hero or Monster models, then for the rest of the game other friendly Orc or Troll models treat Buhrdur as a banner with a range of 6" instead.

additional_rules.name: Brutish Cunning
additional_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 in a Duel Roll when fighting solely against Infantry models (but not Monster models).

additional_rules.name: Glory Seekers
additional_rules.description: If this model is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, then this model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound that Hero when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: A Fool's Challenge
additional_rules.description: Earnur must always Charge an enemy Hero if he able to do so when he Activates. Additionally, he may never decline a Heroic Challenge under any circumstances.

additional_rules.name: Master Duellist
additional_rules.description: At the start of a Combat involving Earnur, before Heroic Strikes are resolved, Earnur may increase his Fight value to match that of a single enemy he is Engaged in Combat with. Additionally, Earnur can never have his Fight Value modified by enemy special rules or Magical Powers.

additional_rules.name: Incantations of Power
additional_rules.description:
After rolling for Priority, Fraecht can spend a point of Will to have one of the following incantations take effect for the rest of the turn.
Strength - Friendly Carn Dum models within 6" of Fraecht must re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.
Endurance - Whenever a Friendly Carn Dum model within 6" of Fraecht suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 5+, that Wound is ignored.
Swiftness - Friendly Carn Dum models that start their move within 6" of Fraecht are not slowed by difficult terrain (except for water features).

additional_rules.name: Armour of Gondolin
additional_rules.description: Whilst Glorfindel is wearing the Armour of Gondolin, enemy Monster models Engaged in Combat with him cannot use Brutal Power Attacks.

additional_rules.name: Hero of the Elves
additional_rules.description: Glorfindel gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes against Monster models.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the West
additional_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, they may re-roll a single D6 when rolling To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Strength of Body, Strength of Will
additional_rules.description: Gulavhar's Attacks are always equal to its remaining Wounds. Additionally, for each Wound Gulavhar has lost, worsen Gulavhar's Courage value by 1 (this will improve again should Gulavhar regain a lost Wound via the Immortal Hunger special rule below).

additional_rules.name: Immortal Hunger
additional_rules.description: Each time Gulavhar slays a model in Combat, it regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battle. These Wounds are regained at the end of the Combat. Gulavhar can only regain Wounds in this way by making Strikes, never by using a Brutal Power Attack.

additional_rules.name: Banner of Arwen Evenstar
additional_rules.description: This is a banner with a range of 6" rather than 3", and Halbarad never suffers the -1 penalty to his Duel Rolls for carrying a banner. Additionally, friendly models within 6" and Line of Sight of the Banner of Arwen Evenstar automatically pass any Courage Tests they are required to take.

additional_rules.name: Brutish Cunning
additional_rules.description: This model may re-roll a single D6 in a Duel Roll when fighting solely against Infantry models (but not Monster models).

additional_rules.name: Gift of Foresight
additional_rules.description: Every time a friendly Arnor model suffers a Wound within 6" and Line of Sight of Malbeth, roll a D6. On a 5+, the Wound is prevented. If failed, Hero models may still use Fate points as normal.

additional_rules.name: Foresight of the Eldar
additional_rules.description: At the start of the game, before either side deploys, roll a D6 and make a note of the result - this is the number of Foresight Points that Malbeth has for the battle. During the roll for Priority, so long as he is alive and on the battlefield, Malbeth can spend these Foresight Points to increase the roll on his controlling player's roll for Priority. For each Foresight Point spent, increase the dice roll by 1, to a maximum of 6.

additional_rules.name: Scavenge
additional_rules.description: Whenever Nazthak slays an enemy model in Combat (with the exception of Monster models), he may choose to scavenge a single piece of wargear carried by that model, with the exception of a Mount, another type of armour, living creatures, the One Ring, or items of wargear that are integral to the model (such as claws and teeth). This will happen before any effects that allow the slain model to pass on that piece of wargear. Add the scavenged item to Nazthak's list of wargear. Nazthak will benefit from the scavenged wargear as if he was the original model. Nazthak may choose to discard any piece of scavenged wargear at any time, though if he does so then he cannot reclaim it - it is lost.

wargear: An amalgamation of grasping spectral hands (hand weapons)

additional_rules.name: Conduit of Angmar
additional_rules.description: If a Ringwraith model is within 6" of a friendly Shade, they may use the Shade to determine range and Line of Sight for a Magical Power. Additionally, after making a Casting Roll within 6" of a friendly Shade, a Ringwraith can choose to deal a single Wound to the Shade to add 1 to the Casting Roll.

additional_rules.name: Swirling Mists
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Shoot Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, a Shade may spend a Will Point to use this ability. If it does, then for the remainder of the turn, enemy models will suffer a -1 penalty To Hit when making a shooting attack that targets a friendly model within 6" of the Shade. If the enemy model making the shooting attack is also within 12" of the Shade, they will suffer a -2 penalty To Hit instead

additional_rules.name: Ghostly Resolve
additional_rules.description: Friendly Angmar Orc models within 12" of one or more models with this special rule gain a bonus of +1 to any Courage Tests they are required to take.

additional_rules.name: Herald of Doom
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of the game, after both sides have been deployed, choose one Hero model in your opponent's Army. Whilst the Shadow of Rhudaur is within 6" of the chosen Hero, that Hero suffers a -1 penalty to their Fate Rolls and a -1 penalty to any Courage Tests they are required to take.

additional_rules.name: Powers of Angmar
additional_rules.description: If the Shadow of Rhudaur rolls a natural 6 when making a Casting Roll, then the target model cannot spend Will Points to attempt to Resist the Magical Power.

options.name: Swap spear and shield for banner

additional_rules.name: Glory Seekers
additional_rules.description: If this model is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, then this model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound that Hero when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Feral Charge
additional_rules.description: When a Werewolf Charges an enemy Infantry model, they gain the Knock to the Ground bonus as if they were Cavalry. This bonus is lost if they are subsequently charged by an enemy Cavalry model.

additional_rules.name: Packlord
additional_rules.description: Friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of this model unless they have the Warg keyword.

additional_rules.name: Packlord
additional_rules.description: Friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of this model unless they have the Warg keyword.

additional_rules.name: Foe Spear
additional_rules.description: A spear, if this model is Supporting a model with an Iron Shield, they gain +1 To Wound when making Strikes against Monster models.

additional_rules.name: Iron Shield
additional_rules.description: A shield that provides +3 Defence to this model rather than the usual +1. Also, this model suffers a –1 penalty to their Duel rolls, unless they are Supported by a model with a Foe Spear.

additional_rules.name: Longbeard
additional_rules.description: After the Priority roll has taken place, Balin may spend a Will point to enable his controlling player to re-roll their D6 in the Priority roll.

additional_rules.description: After the Priority roll has taken place, Balin may spend a Will point to enable his controlling player to re-roll their D6 in the Priority roll.

additional_rules.name: Boar Spear

additional_rules.name: Embedded Axe-blade
additional_rules.description: If Bifur wins a Duel roll, he may make a single Strength 4 Strike against one enemy in the Combat, but will not be doubled if they are Trapped. If he wounds them, the axe-blade in his skull is removed. From that point onwards in each Move phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Bifur may take an Intelligence test. If passed, he may declare a Heroic Move that turn for free.

[dwarven-holds] bifur-the-dwarf-champion.profile: Bifur the Dwarf, Champion of Erebor

additional_rules.name: Embedded Axe-blade
additional_rules.description: If Bifur wins a Duel roll, he may make a single Strength 4 Strike against one enemy in the Combat, but will not be doubled if they are Trapped. If he wounds them, the axe-blade in his skull is removed. From that point onwards in each Move phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Bifur may take an Intelligence test. If passed, he may declare a Heroic Move that turn for free.

additional_rules.name: Sting
additional_rules.description: Elven hand weapon. Bilbo gains a bonus of +1 to his Strength when making Strikes with Sting.

additional_rules.name: It has not yet Awoken
additional_rules.description: Bilbo ignores Sauron's Will section of the One Ring rules. If Bilbo if the only model left on his side, he is not removed as a casualty if he is wearing the Ring.

additional_rules.name: Mattock
additional_rules.description: Two-handed weapon, where if this model wins a Duel roll, they may choose to try and knock down an enemy instead of making Strikes. Choose a single enemy in the combat, and both models roll a D6, adding their Strength values. If this model has an equal or higher result, then the chosen enemy is knocked Prone. This may be done before any other friendly models make their Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Steadfast
additional_rules.description: When a friendly Thorin's Company model within 3" of Bofur is affected by an enemy special rule or Magical Power, they may roll a D6. On a 3+, the model will ignore the effects. For Magical Powers, any Resist tests must be made before using this special rule.

[dwarven-holds] bofur-the-dwarf-champion.profile: Bofur the Dwarf, Champion of Erebor

additional_rules.name: Steadfast
additional_rules.description: When a friendly Erebor Hero model within 3" of Bofur is affected by an enemy special rule or Magical Power, they may roll a D6. On a 3+, the model will ignore the effects. For Magical Powers, any Resist tests must be made before using this special rule.

additional_rules.name: Lumbering
additional_rules.description: If Bombur rolls a natural 6 on a Jump, Climb, Leap or Swim test, he must re-roll the result. Additionally, he may not declare Heroic Moves.

additional_rules.name: Raising Spirits
additional_rules.description: Once per turn in his Activation, choose a friendly Thorin's Company model within 3" and roll a D6. On a 4+, they regain a lost Will point.

[dwarven-holds] bombur-the-dwarf-champio.profile: Bombur the Dwarf, Champion of Erebor

additional_rules.description: Master-forged two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: King Under the Mountain
additional_rules.description: Dain's Stand Fast will cover the entire battlefield, regardless of range. Additionally, friendly Erebor Dwarf Hero models may benefit from his Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: Venerable
additional_rules.description: Whenever Dain makes a Jump, Leap or Climb test, he will roll two D6 and choose the lowest result.

additional_rules.description: Iron Hills models within 12" of Dain automatically pass all Courage tests they are required to take.

additional_rules.name: Fiery Temper
additional_rules.description: After killing his first enemy, Dain must always Charge if able to do so for the rest of the game.

additional_rules.name: Fearsome Charge
additional_rules.description: If Dain Charges into Combat, he gains Terror for the rest of that turn.

additional_rules.name: Headbutt
additional_rules.description: If Dain wins a Duel but fails to slay every enemy in his Combat, select one enemy 25mm model and roll a D6. On a 5+, that model is immediately knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: A Good Sort

additional_rules.name: Durin's axe
additional_rules.description: Master-forged two-handed weapon. Durin may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel roll.

additional_rules.name: The Horn of Zirakzigil
additional_rules.description: A war horn which also gives Durin the Terror special rule.

additional_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
additional_rules.description: Once per game during the Priority phase, after both sides have rolled their dice, you can re-roll your side's Priority roll.

additional_rules.name: The Crown of Kings
additional_rules.description: For each Wound he suffers, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is prevented and ignored.

additional_rules.name: Grasper & Keeper
additional_rules.description: Hand weapons for which Dwalin gains +1 Attack when using Grasper & Keeper, and any To Wound rolls of a natural 6, and not prevented, will cause 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Weapon Master
additional_rules.description: Dwalin is never considered Unarmed.

additional_rules.name: Grasper & Keeper

additional_rules.name: The King's Axemen

additional_rules.name: Dwarven Lords
additional_rules.description: A Dwarf King will always have the Faction keyword of the most common type of Dwarf model in the same Army. They will gain a special rule depending on the keyword they have: Erebor - gains Ancient Enemies (Orc) Iron Hills - gains Fearless. Khazad-dum - gains throwing weapons.

additional_rules.name: Mountain Fighters
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes against a model that is within a piece of difficult terrain, such as a piece of rocky terrain, or a ruin.

additional_text: Crewed by two Dwarf Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

additional_rules.name: Accurate
additional_rules.description: A Dwarven Ballista will only Scatter 3" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Piercing Shot
additional_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D6" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its  movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_rules.name: Combat Synergy
additional_rules.description: At the start of any phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, if Kili and Fili are within 1" of each other, then they can swap places and not have it count as Moving. If they do this, then during the Fight phase of that turn they may re-roll a single D6 in the Duel roll.

For that turn, any shooting attacks of Strength 6 or lower cannot be made if they cross that line, or if the shooting target is within 3" of the line. Similarly in both cases, shooting attacks above Strength 6 must roll a D6. On a 5+, the shot is prevented.

additional_rules.description: A crossbow that fires D6 shots per turn. Only has a limited field of fire 45 degrees to its left or right (can be measured by placing Chariot Pivot Template with the X over the bolt thrower and dotted line running down the wooden shaft connecting the goats). This chariot may move and shoot without any -1 penalty. Can also shoot when Engaged in Combat, with no In The Way tests for models it is in Combat with.

additional_rules.name: Chariot Charge
additional_rules.description: When moving via Chariot Charge, the Chariot will inflict 3 Strength 6 hits.

additional_rules.name: Dwarven Crew
additional_rules.description: Any Iron Hills Warrior that ends their Activation in base contact may join its crew. That Warrior is removed as a casualty and then the chariot immediately regains a Wound lost earlier in the battle.

If this is successful, Mardin must use the following Move to join Durin's Combat if able, or move as close as possible to him. Mardin cannot use this special rule if he is in the same Combat as Durin.

additional_rules.name: Deadeye

additional_rules.name: Protect the Young

additional_rules.name: Orcrist
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, with Orcbane, Goblinbane and Uruk-haibane, Terror (Goblin), Terror (Orc) and Terror (Uruk-hai) special rules.

additional_rules.description: If Thorin Charges into Combat with the Infantry keyword, he may declare a free Heroic Combat in the Fight phase.

additional_text: If your army does not include Thror, Thrain carries the Ring of Durin.

additional_rules.name: Durin's Heir
additional_rules.description: Thrain's Stand Fast has a range of 12" and also affects friendly Dwarf Hero models.

additional_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
additional_rules.description: If Thrain carries the Ring of Durin, once per game after the Priority roll has taken place, you may re-roll the Priority roll.

additional_text: Any Grim Hammer Warriors upgraded to Guardians of the King in Thror's warband will have a Strength value of 4.

additional_rules.name: Arkenstone
additional_rules.description: Thror passes Fate rolls on a 3+, rather than 4+. Also, if the result of a Fate roll is 4+, that roll is free, and does not cost a point of Fate.

additional_rules.name: The Ring of Durin
additional_rules.description: Once per game, after the Priority roll has taken place, you may re-roll the Priority roll.

additional_rules.name: Longbeard
additional_rules.description: After the Priority roll has taken place, Balin may spend a Will point to enable his controlling player to re-roll their D6 in the Priority roll.

additional_rules.name: Grasper & Keeper
additional_rules.description: Hand weapons for which Dwalin gains +1 Attack when using Grasper & Keeper, and any To Wound rolls of a natural 6, and not prevented, will cause 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Weapon Master
additional_rules.description: Dwalin is never considered Unarmed.

additional_rules.name: Dwarven Fury
additional_rules.description: At the start of a Combat, roll a D6. On a 5+, Dwalin may re-roll failed To Wound rolls in that combat. However on a 1, Dwalin reduces his Fight value by D3 before the Duel roll takes place.

additional_rules.name: The Oakenshield
additional_rules.description: If Thorin uses Shielding in a Combat and wins, he may make a single Strength 4 Strike against one enemy involved in the Combat.

additional_rules.name: To Arms!
additional_rules.description: Once per game at the start of his Activation, this rule may be declared. All friendly Erebor models within 3" of Thorin gain +1 Strength until the end of that turn.

additional_rules.name: Hadhafang
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, Arwen gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes again a Spirit model.

additional_text: Any Galadhrim Warriors upgraded to Lorien Guard in Celeborn's warband may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: The Lord of Lorien
additional_rules.description: Celeborn gains a free Will point each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, then the point is lost.

additional_rules.name: Battle Wisdom
additional_rules.description: Friendly Lothlorien Warrior models within 3" of Celeborn gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: The Shipwright's Power
additional_rules.description: Cirdan gains a free Will point at the start of each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, it is lost.

additional_rules.name: Unbreakable Bond
additional_rules.description: If Elladan is slain, make a note of the model that killed him. Elrohir increases his Strength by 1 for the remainder of the game, and must always Charge an enemy if able to do so, prioritising the enemy who killed Elladan. If Elrohir is Engaged in Combat with the model that killed Elladan, and that model is a Hero, he may declare a free Heroic Challenge, regardless of the Hero’s Heroic Tier.

additional_rules.name: Twin Elven Blades
additional_rules.description: Whilst he has the Infantry keyword, Elrohir can choose one of three bonuses at the start of a Combat: Gain 3 Attacks rather than 2, use the Shielding rule, or use his Elven weapons as Elven hand-and-a-half weapons.

additional_rules.name: Strength of Brotherhood
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Elladan, Elrohir gains Dominant (2) and may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Unbreakable Bond
additional_rules.description: If Elrohir is slain, make a note of the model that killed him. Elladan increases his Strength by 1 for the remainder of the game, and must always Charge an enemy if able to do so, prioritising the enemy who killed Elrohir. If Elladan is Engaged in Combat with the model that killed Elrohir, and that model is a Hero, he may declare a free Heroic Challenge, regardless of the Hero's Heroic Tier.

additional_rules.name: Twin Elven Blades
additional_rules.description: Whilst he has the Infantry keyword, Elladan can choose one of three bonuses at the start of a Combat: Gain 3 Attacks rather than 2, use the Shielding rule, or use his Elven weapons as Elven hand-and-a-half weapons.

additional_rules.name: Strength of Brotherhood
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Elrohir, Elladan gains Dominant (2) and may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Hadhafang
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, Elrond gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes again a Spirit model.

additional_rules.name: Vilya
additional_rules.description: Elrond may re-roll any failed Fate points.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the West
additional_rules.description: May re-roll a single D6 in the Duel roll, as well as a single D6 in To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Foresight of the Eldar
additional_rules.description: At the start of the game before deployment, Elrond gains D6 Foresight points. As long as he is alive, Elrond can spend these points to increase his controlling player's Priority roll by 1 for each point spent, to a maximum of 6.

additional_text: Any Galadhrim Warriors upgraded to Lorien Guard in Galadriel's warband may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Nenya
additional_rules.description: Galadriel may re-roll any failed Fate rolls.

additional_rules.name: The Lady of Lothlorien
additional_rules.description: Galadriel gains a free Will point each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, then the point is lost.

additional_rules.name: Mirror of Galadriel
additional_rules.description: Heavy object on a 40mm base, with Defence 8 and Wounds 3. Deployed within 6" of Galadriel. During Priority, if Galadriel or Celeborn are in base contact with it, the controlling player may add 1 to their Priority roll. Additionally, during the End phase of each turn, one friendly Hero within 6" of the Mirror may restore Fate points to their starting value.

additional_text: Any Rivendell Warriors upgraded to King's Guard in Gil-Galad's warband will have a Fight value of 6.

additional_rules.name: Aiglos
additional_rules.description: Elven spear, and a model wielding Aiglos gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: High King of the Elves
additional_rules.description: Gil-galad's Stand Fast is 12", and friendly Elf Hero models may also benefit from it.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the West
additional_rules.description: May re-roll a single D6 in the Duel roll, as well as a single D6 in To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Caras Galadhon Fighting Style
additional_rules.description: This model may use the Shielding rule with their Elven pike. The usual restrictions for Shielding still apply, chiefly that a model using the Shielding rule cannot be Supported by another model, not even by another Guard of the Galadhrim Court.

options.name: Exchange Elven pike for banner and Elven hand weapon

additional_rules.name: One Final Blow
additional_rules.description: When slain in Combat, Haldir can make a Strength 4 Strike against all enemy models he was in Combat with. He may also use Might to increase the To Wound rolls as normal.

additional_rules.name: Orcrist
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, with Orcbane, Goblinbane and Uruk-haibane, Terror (Goblin), Terror (Orc) and Terror (Uruk-hai) special rules.

additional_rules.name: Deadly Shot
additional_rules.description: Legolas can make three shooting attacks during the Shoot Phase. He can still shoot whilst Engaged in Combat, and does not suffer the -1 penalty To Hit for Moving and Shooting, as long as he has the Infantry keyword. He can also shoot at models he in Engaged in Combat with, requiring no In The Way tests.

additional_rules.name: Pinpoint Shot
additional_rules.description: Legolas can make a single shot against an enemy Engaged in Combat with himself or a friendly model. If the To Hit roll is successful, he doesn't need to make any In The Way rolls.

additional_rules.name: Song of Elbereth
additional_rules.description: All friendly Rivendell models within 3" of Lindir gain the Resistant to Magic special rule.

additional_rules.name: Wise Council
additional_rules.description: If Lindir is within 6" of Elrond, then Elrond may spend a single point of Will each turn for free. If he does not use this point by the end of the turn, then it is lost.

additional_rules.name: Wood Elf spear
additional_rules.description: An Elven spear, and this model may use the Shielding rule even if they do not have a shield.

additional_rules.name: Elven Glaive
additional_rules.description: Elven spear, when Engaged in Combat and not being Supported, this model may either gain a bonus of +1 Attack for the Duel roll or +1 Attack when making Strikes. This must be decided before the Duel roll takes place.

additional_rules.name: King's Knights
additional_rules.description: Whilst they have the Cavalry keyword, this model gains a bonus of +1 Fight and +1 Defence whilst within 6" of Thranduil.

additional_rules.name: Elven Glaive
additional_rules.description: Elven spear, when Engaged in Combat and not being Supported, this model may either gain a bonus of +1 Attack for the Duel roll or +1 Attack when making Strikes. This must be decided before the Duel roll takes place.

additional_rules.name: Knife Fighters
additional_rules.description: If Outnumbered in Combat, then before making their Duel roll, this model gains +1 Attack for each model they are Engaged in Combat with, after the first, up to the a maximum of 3 bonus Attacks. This bonus lasts until the end of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Knife Fighters
additional_rules.description: If Outnumbered in Combat, then before making their Duel roll, this model gains +1 Attack for each model they are Engaged in Combat with, after the first, up to the a maximum of 3 bonus Attacks. This bonus lasts until the end of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Whirl of Blades
additional_rules.description: If Orophin rolls a natural 6 in the Duel roll, then he will make double the number of strikes he normally would when rolling To Wound. Note that if the model he is fighting is Trapped, these Strikes will not also gain the benefit for Striking a Trapped model.

additional_rules.name: King's Guard
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Thranduil, this model gains a bonus of +1 to their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: King's Guard
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Thranduil, this model gains a bonus of +1 to their Fight value.

options.name: Horse, Elf bow and Elven lance

additional_rules.name: Swift Parry
additional_rules.description: Rumil may force one enemy model involved in the same Combat as him to re-roll one D6 in their Duel roll. This must be done before all other re-rolls, and before any Might points are spent.

additional_rules.name: Blade Mistress
additional_rules.description: If Outnumbered in Combat, then before making her Duel roll, Tauriel gains +1 Attack for each model she is Engaged in Combat with, after the first. This bonus lasts until the end of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Vengeful Fury
additional_rules.description: If Kili is in your army and killed, Tauriel gains Strength 5 and is reduced to Defence 4 for the remainder of the battle. Additionally, if Kili is killed, Tauriel must always Charge an enemy model when she Activates if possible.

[elven-kingdoms] thranduil-king-of-the-w.profile: Thranduil, King of the Woodland Realm

additional_rules.name: Bladelord
additional_rules.description: If Outnumbered in a Combat, Thranduil may re-roll To Wound Rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. If he has the Infantry keyword, Thranduil may instead re-roll all failed To Wound Rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Fury of the Elvenking
additional_rules.description: If Outnumbered in a Combat, and successfully kills all enemy models that he was Engaged in Combat with, then in the following turn Thranduil may declare a Heroic Combat for free.

additional_rules.name: "Do not talk to me of Dragon fire"
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of his Activation, Thranduil can spend a Will Point. If he does, then until the end of the turn Thranduil gains Terror. Additionally, if Thranduil has the Infantry keyword, then each enemy model within 3" of him, that is not Engaged in Combat, must take a Courage Test in an order chosen by Thranduil's controlling player. If the test is failed, they must immediately Move directly away from Thranduil as far as they can, up to the limit of their Move Value. Models Moved by this special rule cannot Move again during the turn, but may otherwise act normally.

additional_rules.name: Enchanting Song
additional_rules.description:
During their Activation, a Sentinel may sing one of the following songs:
The Hymn of Elbereth - Choose a friendly model within 12", who will  automatically pass all Courage Tests until the End Phase of the turn.
Eldamar Madrigal - Choose an enemy model within 12" who is not Engaged in Combat. They must take an Intelligence Test. If failed, you may immediately Move that model. However you cannot make them enter an enemy model’s Control Zone, dismount, lie down, be forced to Climb, Jump, Leap or Swim, or Move in any way that would cause direct harm. The model affected by this song cannot be Activated later in the turn.
The Lay of Gondolin - Sentinel and all friendly models within 3" gain Terror until the End Phase of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Orc Archers
additional_rules.description: The Orcs in the Howdah are not treated as separate models, and as such cannot be targeted individually. During the Shoot Phase, the Howdah can make a number of shooting attacks equal to its remaining Wounds, using its own Shoot Value. These shots are treated as being made with an Orc bow, can still be made if the Great Beast has Moved over half its Move Value, and do not suffer the -1 penalty for Moving and Shooting. Measure the range from the base of the Great Beast, and Line of Sight from the Commander.

additional_rules.name: Plenty of Orcs
additional_rules.description: If the Orc Commander would lose its last Wound whilst riding the Great Beast, then the Howdah will suffer the Wound instead (this represents an Orc from the Howdah taking command). If the Great Beast is slain, then the Orc Commander will also be slain and removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: On the Hunt
additional_rules.description: During the Shoot Phase, a Warg Marauder can make a shooting attack with an Orc bow for each Moria Goblin Warrior with an Orc bow still alive upon the Warg. These shooting attacks can still be made even if the Warg Marauder has Moved further than half its Move Value that turn, and even if it is Engaged in Combat.

additional_rules.name: Lethal Union
additional_rules.description: Whilst the Goblins remain mounted upon the Warg, the entire model gains the Terror special rule and gains a bonus of +1 to any Courage Tests it is required to take. Additionally, during a Combat a Warg Marauder gains an additional Attack for each Goblin after the first that is still mounted upon the Warg, provided they did not shoot during the Shoot Phase.

additional_rules.name: Death-touch
additional_rules.description: Any model that Wounds Ashrak in Combat, or is Wounded by Ashrak in Combat, must immediately roll a D6. On a 4+ the model immediately suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power; however, the effects will not immediately end should Ashrak have no Will Points or be slain.

additional_rules.name: Spider-kin
additional_rules.description: Only Spider models may benefit from Ashrak's Stand Fast or Heroic Actions. Additionally, whilst within 3" of a friendly Spider model, Ashrak gains the Terror special rule.

additional_rules.name: "For the Dark Lord!"
additional_rules.description: Whilst there is at least one friendly Ringwraith on the battlefield, treat this model's Courage as 4+.

additional_rules.name: Morgul Blade
additional_rules.description: This is a hand weapon. Once per game, a model with a Morgul Blade can use it during a Combat instead of the normal hand weapon; this must be declared before Strikes are made. If they do, all their Strikes must be resolved against a single enemy model, and if the target suffers a Wound that is not prevented in some way, they will immediately lose all remaining Wounds and be removed as a casualty. If the model using the Morgul Blade is mounted, they must use Strength and Attacks of the rider rather than their Mount.

additional_rules.name: Automatons
additional_rules.description: This model may never provide a Stand Fast to nearby Warrior models.

additional_rules.name: Will of the Necromancer
additional_rules.description: This model can spend its Will Points as if they were Fate Points.

additional_rules.name: Bound in Shadow
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Sauron or a friendly Ringwraith model, this model automatically passes any Courage Tests it is required to take.

additional_rules.name: Mindless Killers
additional_rules.description: If this model starts its Activation more than 6" away from a friendly Corsair Bo'sun, it must immediately take an Intelligence Test. If the test is passed, all is fine and this model acts as normal. If the test is failed, then you must choose another friendly model within 1" of this model; the chosen model immediately suffers a Strength 3 hit and, after this Strength 3 hit has been resolved, this model must Charge an enemy model if able. If there are no other friendly models within 1" of this model when it fails its Intelligence Test, then this model's Activation immediately ends. In a turn in which this model fails its Intelligence Test for this special rule, it must re-roll all failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes and gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: "Slay their Horses!"
additional_rules.description: Whilst this model has the Cavalry keyword, it may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes against an enemy Mount.

additional_rules.name: Dunlending War Axe
additional_rules.description: This can be used as either a spear or a two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: Favour of the War Chief
additional_rules.description: If this model is Supporting a Combat, and is within 3" of a friendly Dunland Hero, then this model gains a bonus of +1 to its Fight Value for the duration of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Murderous Power
additional_rules.description: Each time a Dweller in the Dark slays a model in Combat, it regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battle. These Wounds are regained at the end of the Combat. A Dweller in the Dark can only regain Wounds in this way by making Strikes, never by using a Brutal Power Attack.

additional_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
additional_rules.description: Whenever a Feral Uruk-hai suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On the roll of a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_rules.name: Readied Stance
additional_rules.description: Cavalry models do not gain the Extra Attack and Knock to the Ground bonuses whilst Engaged in Combat with Frida, or Engaged in Combat with a model Frida is Supporting.

additional_rules.name: Go for the Horse!
additional_rules.description: Friendly Dunland models within 3" of Frida may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes against an enemy Mount.

additional_rules.name: Impressive Girth
additional_rules.description: Whenever Golfimbul suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On the roll of a 5+, the Wound is ignored. Golfimbul may use Might to influence this roll, though he may not use this special rule against Wounds caused by Magical Powers.

additional_rules.name: Come here maggot!
additional_rules.description: Whenever Goroth suffers a Wound, before any Fate Rolls are made, he may roll a D6. On a 2+, he may choose a single friendly Mordor Orc model within 1" to immediately suffer the Wound instead of him. Fate Rolls can then be made as normal.

additional_rules.name: Ironskin
additional_rules.description: If at the start of the Fight Phase Gorulf is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero model, he may declare a Heroic Defence for free.

additional_rules.name: Trample
additional_rules.description: When a Great Beast Tramples, it will inflict 3 Strength 6 hits.

additional_rules.name: Mithril Crown
additional_rules.description: This is a Unique piece of wargear. Friendly Moria Goblin models within 3" of Groblog gain the Dominant (2) special rule.

options.name: Exchange hand weapon for two-handed weapon

additional_rules.name: Tribal King
additional_rules.description: If this model is your General, it increases its Attacks characteristic to 3 and gains the General Hunter special rule.

additional_rules.name: Shadow Pawn
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Kardush's controlling player can choose to remove him from the battlefield as a casualty if he is within 6" of a friendly Ringwraith. If they do, then a single friendly Ringwraith model within 6" of where Kardush was immediately regains D6 Will Points spent earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Heart of Darkness
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Kardush can choose a single friendly Orc Warrior model within 6" of himself. If he does, the chosen model is removed as a casualty and Kardush immediately regains D3 Will Points spent earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Essence Leech
additional_rules.description: Each time Khamul slays an enemy model in Combat, he immediately regains a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle. Additionally, at the start of the Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Khamul may spend a Will Point to increase either his Fight Value, Strength or Attacks by 1 until the End Phase of the turn. Note this will only ever affect Khamul, not any Mount he is riding.

additional_rules.name: Chariot Charge
additional_rules.description: When a Khandish Charioteer Moves via Chariot Charge, it will inflict 2 Strength 4 Impact Hits.

additional_rules.name: Commanding Presence
additional_rules.description: Friendly Khand models treat a Khandish King as a banner with a range of 6".

additional_rules.name: Unhinged Charge
additional_rules.description: At the start of a Combat in which Mauhur Charged, Mauhur may declare he is using this special rule before any dice are rolled. If he does, then he suffers a -1 penalty to his Duel Rolls; however, if his side wins, he may re-roll any failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes in that Combat.

additional_rules.name: Run and Drum
additional_rules.description: The Drum is considered to be playing as long as both the Drummer and Drum Bearer are in base contact, and the Drummer is not Engaged in Combat. Whilst the Drum is being played it has the following effects: • Friendly Moria Goblin models gain a bonus of +1 to any Courage Tests they are required to take. • Enemy models suffer a -1 penalty to any Courage Tests they are required to take. • Friendly Moria Goblin models within 18" count as being in range of a banner. • Whilst being played, the Moria Blackshield Drum counts as a banner for the purpose of Victory Points.

additional_rules.name: Take up the Drum
additional_rules.description: If the Moria Blackshield Drummer or Moria Blackshield Drum Bearer is slain, then they may pass on their wargear to a friendly Moria Blackshield Warrior within 1" of them. The chosen model becomes a Moria Blackshield Drummer/Drum Bearer (as applicable) and exchanges their wargear for that of the slain model - replace the chosen model with the slain Moria Blackshield Drummer/Drum Bearer.

additional_rules.name: Power from Death
additional_rules.description: Whenever Muzgur slays an enemy model in Combat, he immediately regains a Will Point spent earlier in the battle.

[evil-legacy] razgush-war-leader-of-the-.profile: Razgush, War Leader of the North

additional_rules.name: Bone-breakers
additional_rules.description: This is a Unique hand weapon. Enemy models with an Elven weapon Engaged in Combat with, or supporting a model Engaged in Combat with, Razgush do not receive the bonus to the roll-off should the Duel Roll result in a Drawn Combat.

additional_rules.name: The Beasts of Mirkwood
additional_rules.description: Razgush may include Bat Swarms, Mirkwood Giant Spiders, Mirkwood Hunting Spiders and Fell Wargs in his Warband even if they are not listed in the Army List Razgush is included in.

additional_rules.name: War Leader of the North
additional_rules.description: The range of Razgush's Stand Fast is 12" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Master of Poisons
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Betrayer may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, friendly models with the Poisoned Attacks special rule within 6" of the Betrayer may re-roll all failed To Wound rolls for their Poisoned Attacks, rather than just To Wound rolls of a natural 1.

additional_rules.name: Rule Through Fear
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Dark Marshal may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, friendly Warrior models treat the Dark Marshal as a banner with a range of 6".

additional_rules.name: Sap Fortitude
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Dwimmerlaik may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, whenever an enemy Hero model within 6" of the Dwimmerlaik declares a Heroic Action, they must take an Intelligence Test. If the test is failed the Heroic Action is immediately cancelled, and the Might Point spent to declare it is lost.

additional_rules.name: Armour of the Sundered Land
additional_rules.description: This is Unique heavy armour. Additionally, the Knight of Umbar only loses a Will Point for having been in a Combat, as per the Will of Evil special rule, if his side loses a Combat during the Fight Phase.

additional_rules.name: Combat Mimicry
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Knight of Umbar may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, he may immediately choose a single enemy model he is Engaged in Combat with. The Knight of Umbar can elect to use the Fight Value, Attacks and/or Strength characteristics of the chosen model (in any combination) until the End Phase of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Pall of Darkness
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Shadow Lord may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, Shooting Attacks that target the Shadow Lord, or any model within 6" of him, will only ever hit on the roll of a 6.

additional_rules.name: Progeny
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of her Activation, the Spider Queen may spend any number of Will Points she has remaining to summon a Broodling. For each Will Point spent, place a single Broodling anywhere within 3" of the Spider Queen. Broodlings placed in this manner can never be placed in base contact with enemy models, but may be placed within the Control Zones of enemy models. Broodlings may be Activated on a turn in which they were summoned, though may not Activate as part of a Heroic Move or Heroic March declared by a friendly model that turn as they were not on the board when the Heroic Action was declared. Broodlings are never taken into account when working out if an Army is Broken or reduced to 25%.

additional_rules.name: Miasmatic Presence
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Tainted may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, all Warrior models (both friendly and enemy) within 6" of the Tainted may not benefit from the Stand Fast rule, nor take part in any Heroic Actions.

additional_rules.name: Seeping Decay
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, roll a D6 for every non-Spirit model in base contact with the Tainted, both friendly and enemy. On the roll of a natural 6, the model immediately suffers a Wound. If the model in base contact is a Cavalry model, roll for both the rider and the Mount separately. If after this special rule has been resolved the Tainted is no longer in base contact with any enemy models, then he will not count as being Engaged in Combat that turn (unless he is subsequently Charged as a result of a Heroic Combat).

additional_rules.name: Arcana Leech
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the Undying may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then until the End Phase of the turn, the Undying regains a Will Point spent earlier in the battle every time another model successfully casts a Magical Power within 6".

additional_rules.name: Eternal Willpower
additional_rules.description: The Undying can spend his Will Points as if they were Fate Points.

additional_rules.name: Lord of Dunland
additional_rules.description: The range of Thrydan's Stand Fast is 12" rather than 6".

additional_text: A Warg Marauder consists of three Moria Goblin Warriors riding a single Warg Mount. Two of the Warriors have an Orc bow, the other has a shield. This is treated as any other Cavalry model with the following exceptions: Whilst the Warrior with shield remains alive, all parts of the Cavalry model gain the +1 Defence bonus. The Warg Marauder only counts as a single model towards an Army's Bow Limit. If one Moria Goblin Warrior wishes to dismount, then they must all do so together.

additional_rules.name: Twin Blades
additional_rules.description: A Watcher of Karna with Twin Blades increases its Attacks to 2.

additional_rules.name: Steely Nerve
additional_rules.description: Watchers of Karna gain a bonus of +2 to their Courage Test when attempting to Charge an enemy with the Terror special rule. Additionally, when an enemy model with the Blades of the Dead makes Strikes against this model, this model will treat its Courage value as 5+ rather than 7+ (before any modifiers are applied).

additional_rules.name: Reckless Fighter
additional_rules.description: At the start of any Combat involving Zagdush, before any dice are rolled, Zagdush may choose to reduce his Defence by 1 and increase his Strength by 1. This effect lasts until the Combat is resolved.

additional_rules.name: Mahud Beastmaster Chieftain

additional_rules.name: Piercing Shot
additional_rules.description: A model that is hit by the shot of a Ballista will be flung back D6" directly away from the Ballista if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any model that is passed over by the flung model suffers a Strength 5 hit and will be knocked Prone. If the flung model comes into contact with a piece of impassable terrain or a model with a Strength of 6 or higher, then it will stop and both the flung model and the model or piece of terrain that was hit will suffer one Strength 6 hit. After being flung back, the flung model will be knocked Prone if they survive. If after the model is flung back it would finish over other models and it has survived, then move the other models the minimum distance possible to allow the flung model to be placed where it has landed.

additional_rules.name: Bladed Bolts
additional_rules.description: A Corsair Ballista must re-roll To Wound Rolls of a 1, including against any model that suffers a Strength 6 hit caused by the model that is flung back, if applicable.

additional_rules.name: Pavise

additional_rules.name: Smoke Bombs
additional_rules.description: Throwing weapons with Strength 1. Any target hit, but not slain, must immediately spend a point of Will or suffer the effects of the Transfix Magical Power, and have their Fight value halved until the End Phase of the turn. If Dalamyr rolls a 1 on the To Hit roll, then he has run out of supply and cannot use smoke bombs again for the rest of the game.

additional_rules.name: High King of the South
additional_rules.description: The Mumak War Leader's Stand Fast is 12", and his warband may deploy within 12" of him rather than 6", and may be deployed outside of the Howdah. Measure the 12" range from the base of the Mumak.

additional_rules.name: The Serpent's Weapon
additional_rules.description: At the start of the game, after both sides have deployed, secretly select one Hero model in the opponent's force to be Raza's target. If Raza is Engaged in Combat with this target, after any Heroic Actions have been resolved, reveal Raza's target. Raza gains a +2 bonus to his Fight value whilst Engaged in Combat with his target.

additional_rules.name: The Palanquin
additional_rules.description:
A Mount treated as a single Infantry model (not multiple single models). For any special rules or Magical Powers that affect either the rider or mount, the player using the special rule or Magical Power may choose either the Emperor or Palanquin to be affected. The movement range of the Palanquin will change depending on the remaining Wounds:
3+ wounds - 6" move
2 wounds - 3" move
1 wound - no movement.
For shooting attacks, the shooter must take an In The Way test, where a roll of 1-4 will hit the Palanquin, and 5-6 will hit the Emperor. Models with the Sharpshooter special rule may still choose either the rider or mount as normal.
If the Emperor dismounts or is slain, replace the Palanquin with a number of Black Dragon Warriors with shield equal to the remaining Wounds. No Courage Tests are required for being a Separated Mount. The Palanquin cannot be knocked Prone, other than by a Direct Hit from a Siege Engine. It also cannot be affected by Hurl or Barge Brutal Powers, nor be forced back by Magical Powers, or be flung back by the effects of a Siege Engine.

additional_rules.name: Fighting from the Palanquin
additional_rules.description: The Emperor does not use any of the Palanquins characteristics, only his own. If the Emperor wins a Duel roll, and isn't using the Shielding rule, then after his Strikes are resolved the Palanquin may make a number of Strikes equal to its remaining Wounds. These Strikes cannot benefit from the target being Trapped, but the Emperor can improve them with his Might.

additional_rules.name: Standards of the Emperor
additional_rules.description: A banner with range 6". The Emperor never suffers the -1 penalty in his Duel roll for carrying a banner.

additional_rules.name: In the Name of the Dragon Emperor
additional_rules.description: Friendly Easterling models within 6" of the Royal Palanquin and have line of sight to it, may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Sigils of Defiance
additional_rules.description: The Royal War Mumak and any models in the Howdah gain Resistant to Magic, and whenever they suffer a Wound they may roll a D6. On a natural 6, the Wound is prevented.

additional_rules.name: Awesome Presence
additional_rules.description: Friendly models treat this model as a banner with a range of 6".

additional_rules.description: A war horn, where if Boromir is outnumbered in a Combat, you may ask your opponent to choose one of their models involved, who must take a Courage test. If they fail, Boromir wins the Duel roll.

additional_rules.name: The Banner of Minas Tirith
additional_rules.description: "A banner with a range of 6\". If a friendly Gondor Warrior model within range is involved in a Drawn Combat, and the Combat is tied at the Gondor Warriors

additional_rules.description: In a turn in which he Charges, Boromir gains a +1 bonus To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Well-aimed Shot
additional_rules.description: When making a shooting attack, the first time Damrod fails an In The Way test he may make an Intelligence test. If passed, the In The Way roll will be successful instead.

additional_rules.name: Broken Mind
additional_rules.description: After Priority has been determined, Denethor must take an Intelligence test. If the test is failed, then Denethor is controlled by the opposing player, and may even Charge and fight models from his own Army. When Denethor is Activated by the opposing player he is still considered to be a friendly model, and so friendly models cannot target him with shooting attacks or Magical Powers that cause damage, and may not make Strikes against him if they beat him in a Combat. When under the control of the opposing player, they cannot use any of Denethor's Might, Will or Fate points. Even when under the control of the opposing player, Denethor always counts as a model in his controlling player's Army. If Boromir is part of the same Army, then Denethor will automatically pass this Intelligence test so long as Boromir is alive. However, should Boromir be slain, then Denethor will automatically fail the next Intelligence Test he has to make for this special rule.

additional_rules.name: Go for the Eyes!
additional_rules.description: Duinhir may re-roll failed To Hit rolls when shooting an enemy Monster model. Also, if he successfully Wounds an enemy Monster with a shooting attack that is not prevented, it will deal D3 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the Blackroot Vale
additional_rules.description: Blackroot Vale Archers within 3" of Duinhir may re-roll To Hit rolls of 1 when making shooting attacks, as long as they didn't Move during the preceding Move phase.

additional_rules.name: Glamdring

additional_rules.name: Swift Reload
additional_rules.description: AWhen firing the Bolt Thrower, you may roll two dice and pick the highest result when determining how many shots it may take.

additional_rules.name: Rapid Fire
additional_rules.description: A Bolt Thrower doesn't shoot like a normal Siege Engine. Instead, it may make D6 shoot attacks in the same way as a normal Missile Weapon. No Scatter is required for these shots, they will either hit or miss. Each shot may be fully resolved before determining the target of the next one. Shots fired by the Bolt Thrower do not kill their targets outright if they Wound them.

additional_text: Crewed by three Minas Tirith Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

additional_rules.name: Area Effect
additional_rules.description: After rolling To Hit against a Battlefield Target, all other models within 2" of them suffer a Strength 5 and will be knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Wall-breaker
additional_rules.description: When rolling To Wound against a Siege Target, make two To Wound rolls and pick the highest. Also, a successful To Wound roll against a Siege Target will do D3 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Protectors of the White Tree
additional_rules.description: If within 6" of a friendly Gondor General, this model gains Dominant (2).

additional_rules.description: Whilst Hurin is within 3" of your General, so long as your General has the Gondor keyword, Hurin automatically passes any Courage Tests he is required to make, and may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Lines of Command
additional_rules.description: Your opponent cannot score Victory Points for Wounding or slaying the enemy General, so long as Hurin is alive on the battlefield and your General has the Gondor keyword.

additional_rules.name: Resolute Fighter
additional_rules.description: Ingold and friendly Gondor Warrior models within 3" do not Back Away if they lose a Combat - their opponent must Back Away instead. However, this does not mean that a model benefiting from this rule cannot count as being Trapped, when they lose their Duel roll.

additional_rules.name: Defend the White City
additional_rules.description: Irolas may use the Shielding special rule, even without a shield. If he wins a Combat whilst Shielding, he may make a single Strike against one enemy model.

additional_rules.name: Captain of the Citadel Guard
additional_rules.description: Friendly Citadel Guard within 3" of Irolas gain +1 To Wound when making strikes.

additional_rules.name: The Shards of Narsil
additional_rules.description: If your army also contains Elendil and he is slain, place a 25mm marker where he was killed. If Isildur ends his Activation within 1" of this marker, he gains the Shards of Narsil. This is a hand weapon for which Isildur gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making strikes in a Combat.

additional_rules.name: Kingdoms of Men
additional_rules.description: A King off Dale's Stand Fast is 12", and also affects Dale Hero models.

additional_rules.name: Drain Soul
additional_rules.description: Any model that suffers a Wound from the King of the Dead, that is not prevented by Fate, is immediately killed.

additional_rules.name: The Dead and the Living
additional_rules.description: Only friendly Dunharrow models may benefit from the King of the Dead's Stand Fast or Heroic Actions.

options.name: Exchange shield and lance for banner

additional_rules.name: Master of Reserves
additional_rules.description: In Scenarios where you roll for Warbands to arrive, even if Madril is not on the battlefield, you may modify the roll for Madril's Warband by +1 or -1. If he is already on the battlefield, you may modify the roll for other Warbands in your army.

additional_rules.name: Loyal to the Captains
additional_rules.description: If this model is within 6" or Boromir or Faramir, they may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: The Lineage of Numenor
additional_rules.description: The range of Prince Imrahil's Stand Fast is 12" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Dol Amroth for Gondor!
additional_rules.description: Other friendly Dol Amroth models treat Prince Imrahil as a banner with a range of 6".

additional_rules.name: The Herald's Duty
additional_rules.description: This model receives a bonus of +1 to its Defence for each other friendly model with this special rule it is in base contact with. If you have multiple King’s Champions in your Army, they will only get this bonus for being in base contact with models from their own Warband (i.e., a Herald from one King’s Champion cannot provide the bonus to a model from another King’s Champion).

additional_rules.name: The Life Guard
additional_rules.description: If the King’s Champion this Herald belongs to is Wounded, and this model is in base contact with it, this model may expend its Fate Points on behalf of the King’s Champion. Note that they cannot suffer Wounds on the King’s Champion’s behalf – they may only spend their Fate Points.

additional_rules.name: Lethal Aim
additional_rules.description: Each turn, Anborn gains a free Might Point that can only be spent during a shooting attack on either a To Hit Roll, a To Wound Roll, or an In The Way Test. If this free Might Point is not spent by the end of the turn, it is lost.

[good-legacy] balin-the-dwarf-king-of-mo.profile: Balin the Dwarf, King of Moria

additional_rules.name: Durin's Axe
additional_rules.description: This is a Unique Master-forged two-handed weapon. Additionally, Balin may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll.

additional_rules.name: Longbeard
additional_rules.description: During the Priority Phase, after the roll for Priority has taken place, Balin can spend a Will Point to allow his controlling player to re-roll their roll for Priority.

additional_rules.name: Clean strike
additional_rules.description: If Bandobras rolls a natural 6 To Wound when making a Strike, and the Wound is successful, then the target will suffer 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Boldest of the Bold
additional_rules.description: Cirion gains a bonus of +2 to his Courage Test when attempting to Charge an enemy with the Terror special rule. Additionally, when an enemy model with the Blades of the Dead special rule makes Strikes against Cirion, he treats his Courage value as 4+ rather than 6+ (before any modifiers are applied).

additional_rules.name: In Defence of the King
additional_rules.description: During the Declare Heroic Actions step of the Fight Phase, if a friendly Dwarf General is Engaged in Combat and is within 6" of this model, then this model may declare a free Heroic Combat. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then this model must use the following Move to join the friendly Dwarf General model's Combat. If this is not possible, then this model must Move as close as possible to the Dwarf General. This model cannot use this special rule if it is in the same Combat as a friendly Dwarf General.

additional_rules.name: Legendary Hero
additional_rules.description: The first time each turn Eorl spends a Might Point, roll a D6. On a 4+, the Might Point is free and does not reduce Eorl's store of Might.

additional_rules.name: Spear Mastery
additional_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight Phase, so long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in either the preceding Move Phase or Shoot Phase.

additional_rules.name: Noldorin Daggers
additional_rules.description: These are Elven hand weapons, which Erestor may also use as Elven throwing weapons. Erestor may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes or when making Shooting Attacks with these weapons.

additional_rules.name: Horn of the Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: This is a Unique war horn. Additionally, once per game at the start of any Move Phase, Erkenbrand can unleash a fearsome blow of the Horn of the Hammerhand. Until the End Phase of the turn, enemy models within 24" of Erkenbrand suffer a -1 penalty to any Courage Test they are required to make.

additional_rules.name: Loremaster
additional_rules.description: At any point during his Activation, Floi can spend a Will Point to choose a single enemy model within 12" and Line of Sight of himself. If he does, then for the remainder of the turn friendly models within 6" of Floi gain a bonus of +1 To Wound against the chosen model both when making Strikes and when making Shooting Attacks.

additional_rules.name: The Living Lore
additional_rules.description: Whenever a friendly model slays an enemy Hero or Monster model that Floi can draw Line of Sight to, Floi may regain a Will Point spent earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: The Herald's Duty
additional_rules.description: This model receives a bonus of +1 to its Defence for each other friendly model with this special rule it is in base contact with. If you have multiple King’s Champions in your Army, they will only get this bonus for being in base contact with models from their own Warband (i.e., a Herald from one King’s Champion cannot provide the bonus to a model from another King’s Champion).

additional_rules.name: Master Archer
additional_rules.description: This model only fails an In The Way Test on the roll of a natural 1. Additionally, if this model slays an enemy Hero or Monster model with a shooting attack, then you may restore this model's Might to its starting value.

additional_rules.name: White Sword of Gondor
additional_rules.description: This is a two-handed weapon. Additionally, Strikes made with a White Sword of Gondor have the Mighty Blow special rule.

additional_rules.name: The Bladelord's Skill
additional_rules.description: If this model is Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, it may re-roll a single D6 during the Duel Roll.

additional_rules.name: Powers of Nature
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 during its Casting Test, then upon completion of the Magical Power it regains a number of Will Points equal to the number of Will Points spent during the Casting Test.

additional_rules.name: Birdcalls
additional_rules.description: Mablung and any Rangers of Gondor (including Faramir, Madril, Damrod and Anborn) within 6" of him gain the Stalk Unseen special rule. Additionally, Mablung and any Rangers of Gondor (including Faramir, Madril, Damrod and Anborn) within 6" of him ignore the Stalk Unseen special rule of enemy models.

additional_rules.name: Pride of Dol Amroth
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Prince Imrahil, this model gains a bonus of +1 to their Fight Value.

additional_rules.name: Kalazal
additional_rules.description: This is a Unique hand weapon. Murin gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes against Orc, Goblin or Uruk-hai models.

additional_rules.name: Wood Elf spear
additional_rules.description: An Elven spear, and this model may use the Shielding rule even if they do not have a shield.

additional_rules.name: Powers of Nature
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 during its Casting Test, then upon completion of the Magical Power it regains a number of Will Points equal to the number of Will Points spent during the Casting Test.

additional_rules.name: Vanguard
additional_rules.description: This model may benefit from a friendly Hero model's Stand Fast regardless of range.

additional_rules.name: Riders of Eorl
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Eorl the Young, this model gains a bonus of +1 to their Fight Value.

additional_rules.name: Stone flail
additional_rules.description: Two-handed weapon. If Azog uses this in a Combat, he gains Mighty Blow and reduces his Fight value to 6 for that Combat, even after a Heroic Strike. Any model struck by it and not slain is knocked Prone at the end of the combat.

additional_rules.name: General of the North
additional_rules.description: Azog's Stand Fast has a range of 12", and also affects friendly Orc Hero models.

additional_rules.name: I am the Master
additional_rules.description: When making Strikes against an enemy Hero, he may use this rule. A To Wound roll of a natural 3+ will always count as successful, regardless of the Hero's Defence.

additional_rules.name: The Bringer of Death
additional_rules.description: Keep track of how many enemies that Bolg kills in Combat. After two kills, Bolg gains Terror. After five kills, Bolg gains Harbinger of Evil (12"). After eight kills, Bolg gains Mighty Hero.

additional_rules.name: Hunt Master
additional_rules.description: Whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, Fimbul does not suffer any penalties for Moving through Difficult Terrain, and therefore may still gain bonuses for Charging. Also, whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, Fimbul gains +1 to his Fight value on a turn in which he Charges.

additional_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
additional_rules.description: This model can support other models who also have the Chittering Hordes rule, as if they had a spear. Supporting models cannot use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

additional_rules.name: Mercenary Ambush
additional_rules.description: Warbands lead by a Goblin Mercenary Captain that contain solely Goblin Mercenaries do not have to deploy at the start of the game, as they may be kept in reserve. If you choose to do so, then from turn 2 onwards, the Captain must take an Intelligence test at the end of each of the controlling player's Activation phases. If passed, the player decides whether the warband arrives. If failed, the opposing player decides. If they arrive, they should be fully placed within a terrain piece that the entire warband can hide within or behind. They cannot be placed in enemy Control Zones, cannot Move that turn, but may otherwise act normally. If the Mercenaries cannot be placed as described above, then they may arrive from any board edge via the rules for Reinforcements.

additional_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
additional_rules.description: This model can support other models who also have the Chittering Hordes rule, as if they had a spear. Supporting models cannot use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

additional_rules.name: Mercenary Ambush
additional_rules.description: Warbands lead by a Goblin Mercenary Captain that contain solely Goblin Mercenaries do not have to deploy at the start of the game, as they may be kept in reserve. If you choose to do so, then from turn 2 onwards, the Captain must take an Intelligence test at the end of each of the controlling player's Activation phases. If passed, the player decides whether the warband arrives. If failed, the opposing player decides. If they arrive, they should be fully placed within a terrain piece that the entire warband can hide within or behind. They cannot be placed in enemy Control Zones, cannot Move that turn, but may otherwise act normally. If the Mercenaries cannot be placed as described above, then they may arrive from any board edge via the rules for Reinforcements.

additional_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
additional_rules.description: Whenever this model suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On the roll of a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_rules.name: Catapult
additional_rules.description: A Siege Engine with range 12" - 96" and Strength 10. May still fire in same turn the troll has Moved, but will only hit on the roll of a natural 6. May still fire while Engaged in Combat, but on a To Hit roll of a natural 1, the troll suffers a Wound. Does not have a normal siege crew, and can always be fired if the troll is alive. Other models can never fire this catapult as Untrained Crew. The catapult cannot be destroyed as normal if an enemy spends an entire turn in base contact.

additional_rules.name: Area Effect
additional_rules.description: After rolling To Hit against a Battlefield Target, all other models within 2" of them suffer a Strength 5 and will be knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Goblin Crew
additional_rules.description: If the troll wins a Combat, then after making Strikes, the Goblins may make D6 additional strikes with Strength 3. If the troll uses a Brutal Power Attack that ends the Combat, then the Goblins will not get these additional Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Metal Gauntlets
additional_rules.description: Any Strikes made by the model are resolved as Strength 10. Also, this model may re-roll the dice when determining the Hurl Distance when using Hurl Brutal Power Attack.

additional_rules.name: Relentless Advance
additional_rules.description: Ogres can pass through friendly Orc, Goblin and Bat models when they Charge into Combat, but not when forced to Move from Magical Powers or special rules. Each model they pass through suffers a Strength 3 hit. Any model that the Ogre ends their move on is automatically slain.

additional_rules.name: Crushing Club
additional_rules.description: Any strikes made with this weapon count as having the Mighty Blow special rule. Also, any model struck by this weapon and not slain must roll a D6 at the end of the Combat. On a 3+, that model is immediately knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Scythe Gauntlets
additional_rules.description: A Gundabad Troll armed with Scythe Gauntlets increases its Attacks to 4.

additional_rules.name: Savage Hunters
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

additional_rules.name: Savage Hunters
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

additional_rules.name: Savage Hunters
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 Attacks on a turn in which it Charges.

additional_rules.name: Rhunish Fury
additional_rules.description: Khamul has 3 Attacks instead of 2.

additional_rules.name: One of Nine
additional_rules.description: Maximum of nine Nazgul models in your Army. Hero models wearing the One Ring are not invisible to these models.

additional_rules.name: Unholy Resurrection
additional_rules.description: When slain, place a marker where this model was killed. Models may not overlap these markers for any reason. During the Priority phase of each turn, after Priority has been determined, roll a D6. On a 3+, remove the marker and immediately place this model anywhere within 3" of the marker, but not in base contact with it. If this is not possible, place the model where the marker was. On a 1-2, the model is slain and the marker is removed. The Necromancer can use his Will points to improve this roll, as long as the Nazgul are in range of the Necromancer's Master of the Nazgul special rule. Whilst the marker is in play, this model counts as being on the board for the purpose of determining if your army is Broken or reduced to 25%. However, a marker cannot hold objectives, and this model still counts as being slain for any special rules that come into effect when a model is slain, such as a Heroic Combat. If this model is slain by a Magical Power or an Elven weapon, they suffer a -1 penalty to their roll. When the game ends, any markers still on the board are removed and the associated models will be counted as casualties.

additional_rules.name: Spider Webs
additional_rules.description: A Mirkwood Spider can shoot webs, treated as a throwing weapon with a range of 8". If the spider hits its target, do not roll To Wound. Instead, the model suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power, however the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain. If this hits a Cavalry model, both the rider and mount will be hit. A Hero model hit may spend a Fate point to avoid its effects If the Hero is a Cavalry model, this would negate the effects on both the rider and mount.

additional_rules.name: Silent Hunters
additional_rules.description: If a Mirkwood Hunting Spider is within a piece of woodland terrain, such as a forest, or is partially concealed by a piece of woodland terrain, then they cannot be seen by enemy models unless they are within 6" of the Mirkwood Hunting Spider.

additional_rules.name: Lethal Aim
additional_rules.description: Each Turn, Narzug gains a free Might point that can only be spent during a shooting attack on either the To Hit, To Wound or In The Way roll. If this point is not spent by the end of the turn, it is lost.

additional_rules.name: He cannot yet take Physical Form
additional_rules.description: The Necromancer may use Will points as Fate points.

additional_rules.name: Drain Soul
additional_rules.description: Any model that suffers a Wound from the Necromancer in Combat, and is not prevented, will be automatically slain.

additional_rules.name: Master of the Nazgul
additional_rules.description: Any friendly Nazgul of Dol Guldur in your Army gains a +1 bonus to rolls for their Unholy Resurrection rule, depending on if they are in range of the Necromancer. If he has 20+ Will points remaining, the range of this rule is 18". For between 10 and 19 Will points, the range is 12". For 9 or less Will points, the range is 6".

additional_rules.name: Spiritual Displacement
additional_rules.description: You may include up to two Abyssal Knights. At the start of the Move phase before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the controlling player may remove one of the Abyssal Knights and place them anywhere within 3" of the other Abyssal Knight. It may not be placed in base contact with an enemy, and does not count as Moving. Only one Abyssal Knight may use this special rule per turn.

additional_rules.description: Maximum of nine Nazgul models in your Army. Hero models wearing the One Ring are not invisible to these models.

When the game ends, any markers still on the board are removed and the associated models will be counted as casualties.

additional_rules.name: Executioner
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 during a Duel roll, then it gains Mighty Blow for any Strikes it makes during that Combat.

additional_rules.name: Torturer
additional_rules.description: Keep track of each model he kills. After one kill, he may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. After three kills, he gains Terror. After five kills, he may re-roll all failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: "You have something my Master wants!"
additional_rules.description: The Keeper of the Dungeons gains a +1 bonus To Wound when making Strikes against any model carrying a ring of power - Nenya, Narya or Vilya, the Ring of Durin, or the One Ring.

additional_rules.name: Unnatural Speed
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move phase before the Declare Heroic Actions step, the controlling player may remove this model and place them anywhere within 3" of where they were. It may not be placed in base contact with an enemy, and does not count as Moving.
