additional_rules.name: Angmar Arise
additional_rules.description: You may include up to two Slayers of Men. This model may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes against an enemy Hero. Whilst this model is within 1" of the other Slayer of Men, this model gains the Burly special rule.

additional_rules.name: Angmar Arisen
additional_rules.description: The Witch-king has Fight 6 rather than 5, and 3 Might instead of 1.

additional_rules.name: One of Nine
additional_rules.description: Maximum of nine Nazgul models in your Army. Hero models wearing the One Ring are not invisible to these models.

additional_text: A Troll Brute comprises an Orc Commander and the actual Troll Brute.

additional_rules.name: Trample
additional_rules.description: When a Troll Brute Tramples, it will inflict 2 Strength 10 hits.

additional_rules.name: Piercing Talons
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes in a turn in which it Charges.

additional_rules.name: Pluck
additional_rules.description: If this model Charges into Combat, choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base that the War Bat Moved over and roll a D6. On a 4+, the chosen model is immediately knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: The Price of Failure
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of a Combat he is involved in, if Yazneg is within 3" of Azog, he can declare this rule before the Duel roll is made. If he does so, then Yazneg may re-roll any number of dice during the Duel roll. However, if he uses this rule and fails to win the Duel roll, then he immediately suffers a single Wound.

additional_rules.name: Whoever strikes me shall be accursed
additional_rules.description: After a model has resolved all of its Strikes against Sharkey during a Combat, they must take a Courage Test. If failed, the model immediately suffers a single Strength 4 hit.

additional_rules.name: Broken Loyalties
additional_rules.description: If at the start of any turn Sharkey has been reduced to 1 Wound and has no Fate remaining, Worm immediately becomes an enemy model for the remainder of the game. Also, after this, whenever Worm Activates he must Charge Sharkey if able to do so. If Sharkey is slain, then at the start of the next turn, Worm reverts back to being a friendly model.

additional_rules.name: When He Sneaks
additional_rules.description: Before making a Duel Roll for Worm, check to see if any enemy models, with the exception of any models he is Engaged in Combat with, can see him. If no other enemy models can see him, then Worm increases his Fight Value to 4 and his Attacks to 3 for the duration of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Berserker Blade
additional_rules.description: A hand-and-a-half weapon. If using as a two-handed weapon, the berserker can make a single Strike against every enemy model they were Engaged in Combat with.

additional_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
additional_rules.description: When the berserker suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_rules.name: Sharkey's Spy
additional_rules.description: At the start of the game, before both sides have deployed, Bill may choose an enemy. Whilst Bill is within 12" and has Line of Sight to that chosen model, whenever they declare a Heroic Action, they must roll a D6. On a 1-2, that action is immediately cancelled, and the Might point is not spent. That hero may not attempt to declare the same Heroic Action again that turn.

additional_rules.name: Put 'em in Chains
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Combat, then instead of making Strikes, they may choose a Hobbit model they were Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. If it is higher than the model's Strength, that model is put in chains, treated as if it had suffered the Paralyse Magic Power. However, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain.

additional_rules.name: Keen Sight
additional_rules.description: Enemy models within 12" of Crebain do not gain the benefit of the Stalk Unseen special rule.

additional_rules.name: Cloud of Birds
additional_rules.description: Shooting attacks will only ever hit a Crebain on a natural roll of a 6.

additional_rules.name: Wormtongue
additional_rules.description: Heroic actions cast by enemy heroes within 6" cost 2 Might points, rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: A Traitor Within
additional_rules.description:
Grima can be deployed in one of two ways, though his controlling player must decide which before either Army is deployed. Grima can either be deployed as part of Saruman's Warband (in which case he will not take up a space in the Warband), or as part of the enemy Army.

If Grima chooses to be deployed as part of the enemy Army, he must select an enemy Hero. Once that Hero and their Warband has been deployed, Grima's controlling player can deploy Grima as if he was also part of that Warband, following all the usual deployment rules. Grima is still part of his controlling player's Army, and will Activate like any other model in his controlling player's Army.

If Grima is deployed as part of the enemy Army, then enemy models treat him as a friendly model, and therefore cannot shoot him, Charge him, make Strikes against him, target him with special rules, or make a shooting attack in which Grima would be In The Way. They may also ignore his Control Zone. They can, however, target him with Magical Powers like any other enemy model.

Whilst Grima is considered a friendly model, Grima may ignore the Control Zones of enemy models and may Move through enemy models as if they weren't there. When Grima Moves this way, he cannot end his Move overlapping or in base contact with an enemy model. Grima can choose to Charge an enemy model as normal if he wishes.

These restrictions immediately end if Saruman is slain, if Grima Charges an enemy model, if Grima destroys an enemy Siege Engine, or if Grima interacts with an Objective Marker (such as destroying a Supply Marker or picking up an objective), at which point Grima is treated as a normal enemy model and can be Charged, shot at and slain like any other model.

additional_rules.name: Let's put a maggot hole in your belly
additional_rules.description: If Grishnakh wins a Duel roll, and there are no other allies involved in the combat (including Supporting models), then he can choose a single 25mm enemy model he was Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. On a 4+, that model is knocked Prone before Strikes are made.

additional_text: Crewed by three Uruk-Hai Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

additional_rules.name: Acurate
additional_rules.description: An Assault Ballista will only scatter 3" rather than 6"

additional_rules.name: Piercing Shot
additional_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D6" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_rules.name: Raise the Ladders!
additional_rules.description: An Isengard Assault Ballista can be used to raise a ladder onto enemy battlements in a siege game. Choose a point on the battlements within range and roll to hit. If successful, place a ladder within 6" of the wall base below the target point against the battlements. A model that was carrying the ladder can be placed at the top and will count as charging if there is a defender there. If not, the model can move normally.

additional_rules.name: Find the Halflings
additional_rules.description: Lurtz may choose the result of the Maelstrom of Battle special rule for his warband, rather than rolling.

additional_rules.name: Shield Throw
additional_rules.description: If Lurtz has a shield, he may use it as throwing weapon once per game with a Strength of 4. Any 25mm model hit will be knocked prone, and he may re-roll the To Hit roll. Once thrown, Lurtz will no longer carry the shield.

additional_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
additional_rules.description: Whenever Lurtz suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_rules.name: Let 'em have it!
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, during the Declare Heroic Actions step, Rowan may declare a free Heroic Combat. If he does, he must using the ensuing Move to Charge an enemy Hobbit Hero model. If he cannot do so, then he cannot use this special rule.

additional_rules.name: Put 'em in Chains
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Combat, then instead of making Strikes, they may choose a Hobbit model they were Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. If it is higher than the model's Strength, that model is put in chains, treated as if it had suffered the Paralyse Magic Power. However, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain.

additional_rules.name: Burn it Down!
additional_rules.description: Once per game, if Rowan ends his Move within 1" of a single building or piece of woodland terrain, and he is not Engaged in Combat, roll a D6. On 3+, it is set on fire. Any model within base contact of it during the End Phase of any turn must roll a D6. On a 4+, they are immediately Set Ablaze.

additional_rules.name: Put 'em in Chains
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Combat, then instead of making Strikes, they may choose a Hobbit model they were Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. If it is higher than the model's Strength, that model is put in chains, treated as if it had suffered the Paralyse Magic Power. However, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain.

additional_rules.name: At 'em Lads!
additional_rules.description: Whilst Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hobbit model, this model gains a bonus of +1 to their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: The Palantir
additional_rules.description: Once per game, you may automatically win the Priority roll. Must be declared before any dice are rolled in the Priority roll.

additional_rules.name: Voice of Curunir
additional_rules.description: Saruman's Stand Fast! Range is 12", and affects Hero models.

additional_rules.name: Saruman's Deceit
additional_rules.description: Saruman can choose a single enemy Hero at the beginning of the game. That Hero will suffer a -1 penalty to any Resist tests they make against Saruman's magical powers cast upon them. However, a natural 6 will still count as a 6.

additional_rules.name: Riding Dagger
additional_rules.description: Whenever an enemy model resolves a strike against Sharku (but not his warg) and fails To Wound, Sharku may immediately make one Strength 4 Strike against that model.

additional_rules.name: Fury of the Pack
additional_rules.description: Whilst he has the Cavalry keyword, whenever Sharku Charges he gains Fight 5 and Attack 3 for the rest of the turn.

additional_rules.name: With Me Lads!
additional_rules.description: Other friendly Ruffian models treat Sid as a banner.

additional_rules.name: Put 'em in Chains
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Combat, then instead of making Strikes, they may choose a Hobbit model they were Engaged in Combat with and roll a D6. If it is higher than the model's Strength, that model is put in chains, treated as if it had suffered the Paralyse Magic Power. However, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will points or be slain.

additional_rules.name: Brawler
additional_rules.description: If he is outnumbered in a Combat, Sid may re-roll rolls of a natural 1 in his Duel roll. Sid also never counts as Unarmed.

additional_rules.name: Cunning Mind
additional_rules.description: If Snaga benefits from the Heroic Action of another friendly Hero, he can roll a D6. On a 5+, he regains a Might point that he spent earlier in the battle. Additionally, Snaga can choose not to take part in a friendly Hero model's Heroic Action, and Activate as normal.

additional_rules.name: A Bad Influence
additional_rules.description: Ted may include only include Hobbit models in his warband. Friendly Hobbit models within 3" of Ted gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Head Taker
additional_rules.description: If his army is Broken, instead of taking a Courage test, Ugluk can kill a friendly Warrior within 2" to pass the test, with a Stand Fast Range of 12" that affects both Warrior and Hero models.

additional_rules.name: "Looks like meat's back on the menu, boys!"
additional_rules.description: Upon Activation, Ugluk can kill a friendly Orc Warrior within 2" of him. All friendly Uruk-hai within 6" gain Fearless, and +1 To Wound until the end of that turn. If Ugluk does this when the army is Broken, it will also count as triggering the Head Taker rule above.

additional_rules.name: Berserker Blade
additional_rules.description: A hand-and-a-half weapon. If using as a two-handed weapon, the berserker can make a single Strike against every enemy model they were Engaged in Combat with.

additional_rules.name: Oblivious to Pain
additional_rules.description: When the berserker suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_text: Crewed by two Uruk-Hai Engineers, one Uruk-Hai Berserker with torch, and one demolition charge.

additional_rules.name: Moving the Charge
additional_rules.description: The charge is moved in the same manner as a Heavy Object, on a 25mm base.

additional_rules.name: Demolition Charges
additional_rules.description: A model with a torch can attempt to detonate the charge in the Fight phase, if they in base contact and not Engaged in Combat. See pg.169 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

additional_rules.name: Attacking the Charge
additional_rules.description: The charge has Defence 7 and Wounds 3. Charge can potentially go off when it takes a Wound.  Charge can also be disabled by an enemy model who has only moved into base contact with it that turn. See pg.169 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

additional_rules.name: Bloodoath
additional_rules.description: Friendly Dunland models within 6" of the Oathmaker gain the Fearless special rule.

additional_rules.name: "We will die for Saruman"
additional_rules.description: Whilst Saruman is alive on the battlefield, the Oathmaker and friendly Dunland models must re-roll To Wounds rolls of a natural 1 when making strikes.

additional_rules.name: Flaming Brand
additional_rules.description: A model with a Flaming Brand has the Terror (Cavalry) and Terror (Beast) special rules. Additionally, this model will then count as 2 models rather than 1 when working out how many models are within range of an objective marker.

additional_rules.name: Family Bond
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bain increases his Attacks to 2, and gains a bonus of +1 to his Courage tests.

additional_rules.name: Da! Down here!
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bard the Bowman gains a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value. If Bard the Bowman is within 6" of both Sigrid and Tilda, then he will gain a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value and may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, during the Declare Heroic Actions Step of the Fight Phase, if Sigrid or Tilda are within 6" of Bard and are Engaged in Combat, then Bard may declare a Heroic Combat for free. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then Bard must use the following Move to join Sigrid's or Tilda's Combat. If this is not possible, then Bard must move as close as possible to Sigrid or Tilda. Bard cannot use this special rule whilst he is in the same Combat as either Sigrid or Tilda, unless the other one of Sigrid or Tilda is in a different Combat within 6".

additional_rules.name: Da! Down here!
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Sigrid or Tilda, Bard the Bowman gains a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value. If Bard the Bowman is within 6" of both Sigrid and Tilda, then he will gain a bonus of +1 to his Fight Value and may re-roll a single D6 when making a Duel Roll. Additionally, during the Declare Heroic Actions Step of the Fight Phase, if Sigrid or Tilda are within 6" of Bard and are Engaged in Combat, then Bard may declare a Heroic Combat for free. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then Bard must use the following Move to join Sigrid's or Tilda's Combat. If this is not possible, then Bard must move as close as possible to Sigrid or Tilda. Bard cannot use this special rule whilst he is in the same Combat as either Sigrid or Tilda, unless the other one of Sigrid or Tilda is in a different Combat within 6".

additional_rules.name: Dubious Counsel
additional_rules.description:
At the start of his Activation, Alfrid may choose a single other friendly Lake-town Hero model within 6" of him. Roll a D6 and consult the table below to see what effect Alfrid's counsel has had. Alfrid may spend his Will Points to alter the score on the D6 either up or down by 1 for each Will Point spent in this manner.
1. The chosen Hero loses a Might Point and Alfrid gains a Might Point. If the chosen Hero has no Might Points remaining, this has no effect.
2. The chosen Hero immediately regains a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle.
3. The chosen Hero may re-roll To Wound Rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes until the end of the turn.
4. The chosen Hero gains the Fearless special rule until the end of the turn.
5. The chosen Hero increases their Fight Value by 1 until the end of the turn.
6. The chosen Hero immediately regains a single Might Point spent earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Wall of Blades
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes with their spear against a model that Charged them this turn.

additional_rules.name: Rapid Fire
additional_rules.description: If Bard hits a target with his great bow, he may make another shooting attack with his great bow that targets a model within 3" of the initial target - it may even be the same target. If that second shot also hits, then Bard may Shoot again as described above. Bard can make a maximum of three shots per turn as a result of this special rule.

additional_rules.name: Swift Shot
additional_rules.description: Never suffers -1 penalty for moving and shooting.

additional_rules.name: The Black Arrow
additional_rules.description: If Bard takes the Windlance, then once per game Bard can fire the Black Arrow. If he does, declare this before rolling To Hit. Bard may re-roll any failed To Hit and In The Way rolls. Furthermore, do not roll on the Scatter Table- a successful To Hit Roll against a Battlefield Target will always count as a Dead On result.

additional_rules.name: Windlance Trained
additional_rules.description: If Bard takes a Windlance, he will be the only crew. but can move more than 6" away, and rotate it without any penalty. Windlance attacks against Monster models gain a +1 bonus to any rolls on the Scatter Table.

options.name: Exchange great bow for armour and horse

additional_text: If any member of Bard's Family is slain, Bard must always Charge any enemy that killed one of his children if he able to do so for the rest of the game. If he is in range of multiple enemy targets that he must Charge, then the controlling player may choose one of them.

additional_rules.name: Mithril Coat
additional_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Bilbo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

additional_rules.name: Sting
additional_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Bilbo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

additional_rules.name: It has not yet Awoken
additional_rules.description: Bilbo ignores the Sauron's Will section of the rules for the One Ring. Furthermore, if Bilbo is the only model left on his controlling player's side, and is wearing the One Ring, he is not removed as a casualty as would usually be the case.

additional_rules.name: The Master's Puppet
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, Braga automatically passes all Courage Tests he is required to take and may re-roll all failed To Wound Rolls when making Strikes. This special rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will Points remaining.

additional_rules.name: Captain of the Guard
additional_rules.description: So long as Braga has Will points remaining, friendly Lake-town Guard Captains and Lake-town Guard within 3" of him count as having Dominant (2).

additional_rules.name: Lord of Dale
additional_rules.description: Brand's Stand Fast! Is 12" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Stoic Fighter
additional_rules.description: At the start of any Combat involving Brand, if he would be Trapped upon losing the Duel roll, he may re-roll a single D6 in the Duel roll, and a single D6 when rolling To Wound.

additional_rules.name: Windlance Trained
additional_rules.description: If Girion takes a Windlance, he will be the only crew, but can move more than 6" away, and rotate it without any penalty. Windlance attacks against Monster models gain a +1 bonus to any rolls on the Scatter Table.

additional_rules.name: Lord of Dale
additional_rules.description: Girion's Stand Fast is 12", and friendly Dale models within 3" of him may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: "Stand by our Men!"
additional_rules.description: If Hilda-Bianca Charges into Combat, then during the ensuing Fight phase, she and friendly Lake-town models within 3" of her gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Wall of Blades
additional_rules.description: This model gains a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes with their spear against a model that Charged them this turn.

additional_rules.name: Everyone has a Price
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, this model may re-roll failed To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. This rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will points remaining.

additional_rules.name: Everyone has a Price
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" and Line of Sight of the Master of Lake-town, this model may re-roll failed To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes. This rule has no effect if the Master of Lake-town has no Will points remaining.

additional_rules.name: Onwards Men of Esgaroth
additional_rules.description: Lake-town Militia that are within 3" of a friendly Lake-town Hero model who is Engaged in Combat automatically pass any Courage tests they are required to make for being in a Broken army.

additional_rules.name: Archers, This Way!
additional_rules.description: friendly Lake-town models within 6" and in Line of Sight of Percy may re-roll To Hit results of a 1, when making shooting attacks.

additional_rules.name: Moneybags
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the declare Heroic Actions Step, the Master of Lake-town may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, then Braga, Captain of the Guard, and any friendly Lake-town Guard Captains and Lake-town Guard within 6" of the Master of Lake-town gain a bonus of +1 to their Fight Value and treat the Master of Lake-town as a banner until the end of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Price of Greed
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of the game, your opponent must choose one of their Hero models to be the bearer of a large sum of gold. If the chosen Hero model Moves into base contact with the Master of Lake-town, then the Master of Lake-town must immediately take a Courage Test. If the test is failed, then the Master of Lake-town immediately flees and is removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Save the Gold!
additional_rules.description: Whenever an enemy Hero model within 3" of the Master of Lake-town is removed as a casualty, the Master of Lake-town immediately regains a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle. Additionally, if the Master of Lake-town is in base contact with an Objective Marker during the End Phase of a turn, he may regain a single Will Point spent earlier in the battle.

additional_text: Crewed by two Dale Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

additional_rules.name: Acurate
additional_rules.description: A Windlance will only scatter 3" rather than 6"

additional_rules.name: Piercing Shot
additional_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D3" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_rules.name: Visage of Terror
additional_rules.description: If an enemy attempts to Charge this model and fails its Courage Test (due to Terror), then their Activation will immediately end rather than just not being able to Move than turn. They also cannot Shoot in the Shoot Phase, and cannot Move in the Fight Phase if part of a successful Heroic Combat, but may otherwise act normally.

additional_rules.name: Visage of Terror
additional_rules.description: If an enemy attempts to Charge this model and fails its Courage Test (due to Terror), then their Activation will immediately end rather than just not being able to Move than turn. They also cannot Shoot in the Shoot Phase, and cannot Move in the Fight Phase if part of a successful Heroic Combat, but may otherwise act normally.

additional_rules.name: Visage of Terror
additional_rules.description: If an enemy attempts to Charge this model and fails its Courage Test (due to Terror), then their Activation will immediately end rather than just not being able to Move than turn. They also cannot Shoot in the Shoot Phase, and cannot Move in the Fight Phase if part of a successful Heroic Combat, but may otherwise act normally.

additional_rules.name: Easterling Halberd
additional_rules.description: This weapon can be used as either a pike or two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: Phalanx
additional_rules.description: Easterlings can use pike and shield without penalty. If an Infantry model with this rule loses a Combat, up to two other models that also have the Phalanx rule can Make Way, instead of one.

additional_rules.name: Easterling Halberd
additional_rules.description: This weapon can be used as either a pike or two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: Phalanx
additional_rules.description: Easterlings can use pike and shield without penalty. If an Infantry model with this rule loses a Combat, up to two other models that also have the Phalanx rule can Make Way, instead of one.

additional_rules.name: Orcish Brawler
additional_rules.description: If outnumbered in a Combat, Gorbag gains +1 to his Attack value for the duration of the Combat.

additional_rules.name: Adaptive Fighter
additional_rules.description: If Gorbah wins a Duel Roll, he may choose an enemy model involved in the Combat, and that model must back away in a direction chosen by Gorbag. For example, they may be forced to back away over the edge of cliff, and take fall damage. Other models then back away as normal and Strikes are resolved.

additional_rules.name: "The time of the Orc has come"
additional_rules.description: Once per game, at the start of any Fight phase, all friendly Mordor Orc models within 12" may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: "The Age of Men is Over"
additional_rules.description: Friendly Mordor Orc models within 3" gain the Hatred (Man) special rule.

additional_rules.name: Gothmog's Right Hand
additional_rules.description: If Gothmog's Enforcer is within 3" of Gothmog, then Gothmog may spend one of Gothmog's Enforcer's Will points to declare a Heroic Move or Heroic March, instead of spending his own Might points. Additionally, when Gothmog declares a Heroic March or Heroic Move within 3" of Gothmog's Enforcer, Gothmog can measure the range of the With Me or At the Double from Gothmog's Enforcer, rather than himself.

additional_rules.name: Master of Reserves
additional_rules.description: "In Scenarios where you roll for Warbands to arrive, even if Guritz is not on the battlefield, you may modify the roll for Guritz

additional_rules.name: End the Race of Man
additional_rules.description: Whilst Engaged in Combat with an enemy Man model, Guritz gains a +1 bonus to his Fight value.

additional_rules.name: End the Race of Man
additional_rules.description: Whilst Engaged in Combat with an enemy Man model, this model gains a +1 bonus to his Fight value.

additional_rules.name: End the Race of Man
additional_rules.description: Whilst Engaged in Combat with an enemy Man model, this model gains a +1 bonus to his Fight value.

additional_rules.name: Whip of the Masters
additional_rules.description: Each time a friendly Hero model within 6" attempts a Heroic Move, Heroic March or Heroic Shoot, roll a D6. On a 4+, that action is free for that Hero.

additional_text: Crewed by three Mordor Orc Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran.

additional_rules.name: Accurate
additional_rules.description: A Mordor Siege Bow will only Scatter 3" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Piercing Shot
additional_rules.description: A model hit will be flung back D6" if it has a Strength of 5 or lower. Any models passed over are knocked prone and take a Strength 5 hit. The flung model stops if it hits impassable terrain or a model with Strength 6 or higher, and both take a Strength 6 hit. The flung model is knocked prone if it survives. If the flung model would end its  movement over other models, those models are moved the minimum distance to allow the flung model to be placed.

additional_rules.name: Cleaving Blow
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 To Wound, and the Wound is successful, the target suffers 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Cleaving Blow
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 To Wound, and the Wound is successful, the target suffers 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_text: Crewed by three Mordor Orc Siege Crew, one of which is the Siege Veteran, and a Mordor Siege Troll.

additional_rules.name: Troll Loader
additional_rules.description: May re-roll the To Hit roll if the Siege Troll is one of the models firing the catapult this turn.

additional_rules.name: Area Effect
additional_rules.description: After rolling To Hit against a Battlefield Target, all other models within 2" of them suffer a Strength 5 and will be knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Wall-breaker
additional_rules.description: When rolling To Wound against a Siege Target, make two To Wound rolls and pick the highest. Also, a successful To Wound roll against a Siege Target will do D3 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Sense of Impending Doom
additional_rules.description: Enemy models within 6" of the Mouth of Sauron cannot re-roll 1s in the Duel Roll, regardless of special rules that would normally allow them to do so.

additional_rules.name: Morgul Blade
additional_rules.description: Once per game, direct all attacks against one model, and if they suffer at least one wound that is not prevented by Fate, they are instantly killed.

additional_rules.name: Hands off the shiny shirt, that's mine!
additional_rules.description: During a Scenario that involves picking up and carrying Objectives, and during his Move, Shagrat can choose a friendly model within 3" who is carrying an Objective and take an Intelligence test. If passed, he gains possession of the Objective, even if not normally allowed to be passed. He can also carry multiple Objectives, even if the Scenario normally doesn't allow for it.

additional_rules.name: Cleaving Blow
additional_rules.description: If this model rolls a natural 6 To Wound, and the Wound is successful, the target suffers 2 Wounds rather than 1.

additional_rules.name: Lone Hunter
additional_rules.description: Shelob may never be taken as part of another model's Warband, or benefit from the Heroic Actions of other models.

additional_rules.name: She is always hungry
additional_rules.description: If not Engagement in Combat at the start of her Activation, Shelob can kill a friendly model within 1". If she does, until the end of that turn, she may re-roll one dice in any Duel roll.

additional_rules.name: She hungers for sweeter meats
additional_rules.description: Shelob gains +1 Attack whilst Engaged in Combat with an enemy Man, Elf Dwarf or Hobbit model.

additional_rules.name: Caught in a Web
additional_rules.description: Shelob can choose to direct a single strike at one model in the Combat. That model suffers one Strength 8 hit, and if it survives, the model is treated as being under the effect of the Paralyse magical power. The model will also not automatically recover if Shelob is slain, leaves the board, or reduced to zero Will points.

additional_rules.name: A Fell Light is in Them
additional_rules.description: At the end of spectre's move, it can choose an enemy model within 12" and in Line of Sight. The model must pass an Intelligence test. If failed, you may move that model directly towards the spectre, up to its maximum Move value, even if it has already moved that turn. The model will stop moving if it would enter an enemy Control Zone (though they will never count as charging in this instance, and therefore cannot be involved in Combat with them), comes into contact with an Obstacle, impassable terrain, cliff edge, or another model. This cannot be used to move a model out of Combat, make them dismount, drop an item, or Lie Down. However this move can be used to make the model Charge the spectre. A model affected by this special rule cannot Move any further that turn, and may not use Active abilities.

additional_rules.name: The Lord of the Rings
additional_rules.description: Free point of Will to be spent each turn.

additional_rules.name: The One Ring
additional_rules.description: Roll a D6 each time Sauron loses his last Wound. On 2+, restore 1 Wound. May use Might to improve this roll.

additional_rules.name: Unstoppable!
additional_rules.description: Can make one Strength 8 hit on all models involved in the Combat, including all supporting models.

additional_rules.name: The Flames of Evil
additional_rules.description: Can make a Strength 10 strike against one model. If they survive, they are Set Ablaze and knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Morgul Blade
additional_rules.description: Once per game, direct all attacks against one model, and if they suffer at least one wound that is not prevented by Fate, they are instantly killed.

additional_rules.name: Crown of Morgul
additional_rules.description: Enemies within 6" or those who Charge the Witch-king cannot benefit from automatically passing Courage tests, except for Heroic Resolve. Additionally, once per game, at the start of any Fight phase, you can imbue great power to his hand weapon, and until the end of the turn, any model that suffers a Wound from the Witch-king is Set Ablaze.

additional_rules.name: Feral
additional_rules.description: Will always flee when separated.

additional_rules.name: Swift Gallop
additional_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Ashere, and when Hera activates, she can choose to gain Move 12" and Woodland Creature until the end of her activation, but cannot Charge during this move.

additional_rules.name: Sure-footed Steed
additional_rules.description: If the rider is knocked prone whilst riding Brego, and Brego isn't killed, they can roll a D6. On a 6, the rider stays mounted and isn't knocked prone. They can use Might to improve this roll.

additional_rules.name: Feral
additional_rules.description: Will always flee when separated.

additional_rules.name: Gandalf's Rockets
additional_rules.description: In every Shoot phase, Gandalf can shoot a firework at an enemy in Line of Sight and within 6", even if Engaged in Combat. No In The Way rolls are required for this special rule. There are four different fireworks to choose from - see pg.12 of Armies of LOTR book for the full details.

additional_text: If Radagast dismounts from the Great Eagle, it will automatically pass its Courage test for being a Separated Mount.

additional_rules.name: Majestic Steed
additional_rules.description: In a turn in which Thranduil Charges into Combat, he resolves his Strikes at Strength 5. Additionally, each time this model Charges into Combat, it will inflict a single Strength 4 hit upon one model it has Charged (Cavalry models suffer this hit on both the rider and the Mount). If after this hit Thranduil is no longer Engaged in Combat, he may continue his Move in any way his controlling player wishes; stopping straight away, Charging another enemy model, or anything in between.

additional_rules.name: Rapid-fire Bolt Thrower
additional_rules.description: A crossbow that fires D6 shots per turn. Only has a limited field of fire 45 degrees to its left or right (can be measured by placing Chariot Pivot Template with the X over the bolt thrower and dotted line running down the wooden shaft connecting the goats). This chariot may move and shoot without any -1 penalty. Can also shoot when Engaged in Combat, with no In The Way tests for models it is in Combat with.

additional_rules.name: Chariot Charge
additional_rules.description: When moving via Chariot Charge, the Chariot will inflict 3 Strength 6 hits.

additional_rules.name: Dwarven Crew
additional_rules.description: Any Iron Hills Warrior that ends their Activation in base contact may join its crew. That Warrior is removed as a casualty and then the chariot immediately regains a Wound lost earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Chariot Charge
additional_rules.description: When a Khandish Charioteer Moves via Chariot Charge, it will inflict 2 Strength 4 Impact Hits.

additional_text: If Radagast dismounts from his Sleigh, it must be removed from play.

additional_rules.name: Chariot Charge
additional_rules.description: When Radagast's Sleigh Moves via Chariot Charge, it will inflict 2 Strength 4 Impact hits.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the Mearas
additional_rules.description: Whilst mounted upon Shadowfax, Gandalf rolls two dice and picks for the highest for Jump, Leap and Swim tests. Also, Shadowfax only halves his Move value in difficult terrain, rather than quartering it.

additional_rules.name: Faithful Servant
additional_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Snowmane, Theoden may re-roll failed Courage tests when charging an enemy with Terror.

additional_rules.name: Faithful Servant
additional_rules.description: Whilst mounted on Snowmane, Theoden may re-roll failed Courage tests when charging an enemy with Terror.

additional_rules.name: Pack Master
additional_rules.description: Once separated from Azog, only Warg models may benefit from the White Warg's Stand Fast And benefit from its Heroic Actions.

additional_rules.name: Trample
additional_rules.description: When a Troll Brute Tramples, it will inflict 2 Strength 10 hits.

additional_rules.name: Impaler
additional_rules.description: Each time this model Charges into Combat, it will inflict a single Strength 4 hit upon one model it has Charged (Cavalry models suffer this hit on both the rider and the Mount). If after this hit, this model is no longer Engaged in Combat, they may continue their Move in any way their controlling player wishes; stopping straight away, Charging another enemy model, or anything in between. Each time this model Charges into Combat, it will inflict a single Strength 4 hit upon one model it has Charged (Cavalry models suffer this hit on both the rider and the Mount). If after this hit, this model is no longer Engaged in Combat, they may continue their Move in any way their controlling player wishes; stopping straight away, Charging another enemy model, or anything in between.

additional_rules.name: Devastating Charge
additional_rules.description: When this model Charges against one or more 25mm models, roll a D6 for each. On a 5+, that model is immediately knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Unsteady nerves
additional_rules.description: Aldor must always shoot first in the Shoot phase, even before Heroic Shoots are resolved.

additional_rules.name: Lucky Shot
additional_rules.description: Aldor must re-roll failed To Hit and To Wound rolls when making a shooting attack.

[rohan] deorwine-chief-of-the-kings-knig.profile: Deorwine, Chief of the King's Knights

additional_rules.name: For Theoden!
additional_rules.description: During the Declare Heroic Actions step of the Fight Phase, if Theoden is Engaged in Combat within 6", Deorwine may call a Heroic Combat for free. If the action is successful, you must use the following move to join Theoden's Combat, or get as close as possible to him. He cannot use this special rule if he is in the same Combat as Theoden.

additional_rules.name: Pinpoint Accuracy
additional_rules.description: Elfhelm may re-roll To Hit, To Wound and In The Way rolls when using his throwing spears, and never suffers the normal -1 penalty when moving and shooting with his throwing spears.

additional_rules.name: Guthwine
additional_rules.description: If Eomer rolls a natural 6 To Wound, he may make an additional To Wound roll against the same target. If the additional roll is a natural 6, it does not benefit from this special rule.

additional_rules.name: The Price of Grief
additional_rules.description: If Theoden or Eowyn are in the same army, and either are slain, Eomer must re-rolls all failed To Wound rolls for the rest of the game, and he must charge if able to do so.

additional_rules.name: I Shall Kill You if You Touch Him
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of Theoden, Eowyn may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1. If Theoden is slain, she becomes Fearless, and re-rolls any failed To Wound rolls when striking the model who slew Theoden.

additional_rules.name: Merry
additional_rules.description: If taken as an option, Merry becomes a passenger on Eowyn's horse. He will have a shield, be an Independent Hero, and still count towards the army's total models and Break Point. He does not take up a space in Eowyn's warband. Whilst he remains mounted, Eowyn gains Resistant to Magic, Attack 3, and can spend Merry's Might, Will and Fate.

additional_rules.name: Mutual Respect
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 6" of Hera, Frealaf gains the Master of Battle (4+) special rule.

additional_rules.name: Lord of Harrowdale
additional_rules.description: Any Warriors of Rohan in Frealaf's warband are upgraded to Warriors of Harrowdale. If they have Line of Sight to Frealaf, these warriors may re-roll failed Intelligence tests and gain Shieldwall.

additional_rules.name: Royal Standard of Rohan
additional_rules.description: Banner with range 6", Gamling does not suffer the -1 penalty in the Duel roll. If a friendly Rohan Hero model within 6" spends a Might point, they may roll a D6. On a natural 6, the point of Might is free.

additional_rules.name: Defender of Edoras
additional_rules.description: Whenever Haleth is outnumbered in Combat, if he wins the Duel roll he may re-roll failed To Wound rolls.

additional_rules.name: There is Always Hope
additional_rules.description: Haleth has Attack 2 whilst he is within 6" of Aragorn.

additional_rules.name: Fight to the Last
additional_rules.description: If Haleth is engaged in combat, Aragorn and friendly Rohan Infantry models within 6" gain +1 Fight value. This ends immediately if Haleth is slain.

additional_rules.name: Doorward of Meduseld
additional_rules.description: As long as Theoden is alive and on the battlefield, Hama and any Rohan Royal Guard within 6" of him count as having the Dominant (2) special rule.

additional_rules.name: The Warrior Poet
additional_rules.description: Hama may spend a Will point at the start of any Fight phase. If he does so, friendly Rohan models within 6" of him may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1, until the end of that turn.

additional_rules.name: The Horn of the Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: Once per game at start of any Move phase, Helm can blow this horn. Until the end of that turn, enemy models within 24" of Helm suffer a -1 penalty to Courage tests.

additional_rules.name: The Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: Helm never counts as unarmed.

additional_rules.name: Into the Fray
additional_rules.description: Helm may declare a free Heroic Combat each Fight phase. However, after he has slain an enemy model, he must always Charge an enemy model if possible, for the rest of the battle.

[rohan] helm-hammerhand-wraith-of-the-ho.profile: Helm Hammerhand, Wraith of the Hornburg

additional_rules.name: The Horn of the Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: Once per game at start of any Move phase, Helm can blow this horn. Until the end of that turn, enemy models within 24" of Helm suffer a -1 penalty to Courage tests.

additional_rules.name: The Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: Helm never counts as unarmed.

additional_rules.name: No Longer a Leader
additional_rules.description: Helm can never be your General. He cannot call Stand Fast and models cannot benefit from his Heroic Actions.

additional_rules.name: Berserk Rage
additional_rules.description: Helm must always Charge if able to do so. When he Charges, he gains Terror until the end of the turn, and may declare a free Heroic Combat in the Fight phase.

additional_rules.name: Spyglass
additional_rules.description: Hera may ignore the Stalk Unseen special rule of enemy models, and may draw Line of Sight to them as normal.

additional_rules.name: Daughter of Rohan
additional_rules.description: If Hera is in a 1-on-1 combat with no supporting models involved, she gains Attack 3 and may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1.

additional_rules.name: Fury of the Hammerhand
additional_rules.description: When Hera Charges, she must re-roll any failed To Wound rolls in that turn.

additional_rules.name: The Warrior Bride
additional_rules.description: Enemy models Engaged in Combat with Hera cannot declare a Heroic Strike.

additional_rules.name: Orders from Edoras
additional_rules.description:
Lief may spend a Will point at the end of his Activation, as long as he is not Engaged in Combat, to pick one of the following orders that last until the end of the turn. Each order can only be chosen once per game.
1. Friendly Rohan Hero models within 3" can declare a free Heroic Combat.
2. Friendly Rohan models within 3" gain the Fearless special rule.
3. Friendly Rohan models with 3" do not suffer the -1 penalty To Hit when moving and shooting, and may re-roll failed To Hit rolls.
4. Friendly Rohan models that start their Activation within 3" of Lief gain Woodland Creature and Mountain Dweller.
5. Friendly Rohan models that start their Activation within 3" of Lief increase their Move value by 2".

additional_rules.name: Stalwart Fighter
additional_rules.description: Whilst Olwyn is outnumbered in Combat, enemy models require a 6 To Wound her, regardless of Strength. Enemy models may still use Might to influence their To Wound rolls as normal.

additional_rules.name: Arise, Riders of Rohan!
additional_rules.description: If this model is within 12" of a Rohan General and has the Cavalry keyword, it receives +1 bonus to its Fight value on a turn in which they Charge.

additional_rules.name: Spear Mastery
additional_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

additional_rules.name: Arise, Riders of Rohan!
additional_rules.description: If this model is within 12" of a Rohan General and has the Cavalry keyword, it receives +1 bonus to its Fight value on a turn in which they Charge.

additional_rules.name: Spear Mastery
additional_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

additional_rules.name: Herugrim
additional_rules.description: If a Combat is tied at Fight value, Theoden wins. If both sides have a similar special rule, roll off as normal.

additional_rules.name: Forth, and Fear no Darkness
additional_rules.description: Theoden's Stand Fast! Is 12" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: The will of Men is easily corrupted
additional_rules.description: If Theoden is within 6" of Grima, Theoden is reduced to Fight 3, cannot declare Heroic Actions or spend Will points.

additional_rules.name: Reckless Charge
additional_rules.description: Theodred must Charge enemy models if able to so. Additionally, when he charges, re-roll any failed To Wound rolls in that fight.

additional_rules.name: Spear Mastery
additional_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

additional_rules.name: Barricade
additional_rules.description: A Barricade should be no more than 3" in length, 1" in width and 1" in height. A Barricade can be defended in the same way as a Barrier (see page 54), and can be jumped over in the same way as an Obstacle. A Barricade has a Defence of 7 and 2 Wounds.

additional_rules.name: Battering Ram
additional_rules.description: A Battering Ram is a Heavy Object, however, it is not mounted on a 25mm base and will simply use the template of the model when carried. If it is not being carried, a Battering Ram can be shot and attacked as normal; it counts as having a Defence of 8 and 3 Wounds. A Battering Ram must always have a minimum of two models carrying it, otherwise it cannot be carried.

additional_rules.name: Boiling Oil
additional_rules.description:
A vat of Boiling Oil is a Heavy Object and is represented by a 40mm base. If two defending models are in base contact with the Boiling Oil, and are not Engaged in combat, they can pour it on an attacker as a Shooting Attack. This Shooting Attack can only target enemy models within 1" of the walls, or climbing a Siege Ladder, and has a range of 4". Models making a shooting attack with Boiling Oil treat their Shoot value as 2+ regardless of its actual value. Any model hit by Boiling Oil suffers one Strength 8 hit, and any model (friend or foe) within 2" of the target suffers one Strength 4 hit. A model climbing a Siege Ladder that is hit must roll a D6, and on a 1-4 they will fall off and suffer Falling Damage.



After making a Shooting Attack with Boiling Oil, the defender rolls a D6. On a 1, the supply of oil has run dry and that vat of Boiling Oil cannot be used for the remainder of the game.

additional_rules.name: Rallying Point
additional_rules.description: A Rallying Point is represented by a 25mm base. Models may Move over a Rallying Point but cannot finish their Move overlapping it. Defending models treat a Rallying Point as a Banner. Additionally, defending models within 6" of a Rallying Point apply a -1 modifier to any Courage Tests they are required to take. If, during the End phase of a turn, an enemy model is in base contact with a Rallying Point, that model hasn't done anything during that turn except Move (i.e. has not made a Shooting Attack, Cast a Magical Power, been Engaged in Combat), and that model was not affected by a Magical Power that turn, then it can destroy the Rallying Point - remove it from play.

additional_rules.name: Rocks
additional_rules.description: A pile of Rocks is represented by a 25mm base and is a Light Object. A defending model in base contact with the Rocks and in base contact with the battlements can make a Shooting Attack with them during the Shoot Phase. This Shooting Attack can only target enemy models within 1" of the walls or climbing a Siege Ladder, and has a range of 8". A model making a Shooting attack with a rock treats their Shoot value as 4+ regardless of its actual value. Any model hit by a rock suffers one Strength 6 hit. A model climbing a Siege Ladder that is hit must roll a D6, and on a 1-3 they will fall off and suffer Falling Damage.

additional_rules.name: Siege Ladder
additional_rules.description: A Siege Ladder is a Heavy Object, however, it is not mounted on a 25mm base and will simply use the template of the model when carried. If it is not being carried, a Siege Ladder can be shot at and attacked as normal; it counts as having a Defence of 8 and 2 Wounds. If any model that is carrying a Siege Ladder Moves into base contact with the walls of the fortress, the Siege Ladder is immediately raised; place it in position against the wall. Models may Move up a Siege Ladder in the same way as a normal ladder.

additional_rules.name: Siege Tower
additional_rules.description:
A Siege Tower should be tall enough for the ramp to reach the battlements of the fortress when lowered and should be no more than 4" wide across the ramp. Infantry models may be deployed within or on top of a Siege Tower, with the exception of Monster models. A Siege Tower can be pushed by friendly models, and will Move 6" when they do so. It requires six Infantry models to push a Siege Tower, with an additional Infantry model required for each model in or on the Siege Tower. Monster models count as six models for the purpose of pushing a Siege Tower. To count as pushing a Siege Tower, a model must be in base contact with either the rear or side of the Siege Tower, or in base contact with another model that is pushing from the rear.



If a Siege Tower moves into base contact with the fortress in the Move Phase, then the ramp is immediately lowered. Models in the Siege Tower do not count as Moving whilst the Siege Tower is being pushed, unless they specifically Move within it.



A Siege Tower can be shot at or attacked normally, has a Defence of 10 and 4 Wounds, and is a Battlefield Target. If a siege tower would be destroyed, all models in or on it will suffer Falling Damage.

additional_rules.name: Barricade
additional_rules.description: A Barricade should be no more than 3" in length, 1" in width and 1" in height. A Barricade can be defended in the same way as a Barrier (see page 54), and can be jumped over in the same way as an Obstacle. A Barricade has a Defence of 7 and 2 Wounds.

additional_rules.name: Spiked Barricade
additional_rules.description:
A Spiked Barricade follows all the rules for a regular Barricade, with the following additions:

- Any model that attempts to jump over a Spiked Barricade will suffer one Strength 3 hit after resolving their jump test, unless they rolled a 6.

- Any model that is fighting across a Spiked Barricade and accidentally Strikes it instead of their opponent immediately suffers one Strength 3 hit.

additional_rules.name: Breathe Fire
additional_rules.description: This is treated as a bow with range 18". If the shot hits, the target and all models within 2" suffer a Strength 10 hit. Any model that suffers a Wound which is not prevented is slain, otherwise they are Set Ablaze. If a model is immune to fire-based based attacks, they are immune to this shooting attack.

additional_rules.name: Immovable Object
additional_rules.description: Cannot be knocked Prone, or forced to Move by Magic Powers and special rules. Smaug never counts as Trapped and never backs away - his opponent must always Back Away instead.

additional_rules.name: Desolator of the North
additional_rules.description: Smaug may spend a free Will point each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, then the point is lost.

additional_rules.name: Missing Scale
additional_rules.description: If a model rolls a natural 6 on a shooting attack against Smaug, and the To Wound roll is also successful, he will suffer a number of Wounds equal to the strength of the missile weapon.

additional_rules.name: "I am fire, I am death"
additional_rules.description: Immune to fire-based attacks.

additional_rules.name: Colossal Frame
additional_rules.description: Enemies may still shoot Smaug even if he is Engaged in Combat. No In The Way test is required for friendly models he is Engaged in Combat with.

additional_rules.name: Unstoppable Momentum
additional_rules.description: Instead of making Strikes, Smaug can make a single Strength 9 hit on every model he is Engaged with.

additional_rules.name: Ring of Barahir
additional_rules.description: When affected by a Magical Power, and after any resist tests, Aragorn may roll a D6. On a 6, he is not affected by that power.

additional_rules.name: Anduril, Flame of the West
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon, never needs more than a 4+ To Wound, or a 3+ if using Anduril as a two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: Champion Stone Skipper
additional_rules.description: Baldo may re-roll failed To Hit Rolls when throwing stones. Additionally, if Baldo rolls a natural 6 when rolling To Hit, do not take any In The Way Tests and do not roll To Wound. Baldo's target automatically suffers a Wound.

additional_rules.name: Master of Traps
additional_rules.description:
At the start of the game, after both sides have deployed, Baldo may place eight 25mm Trap Markers face-down on the board; two each of Snare Traps, Tripwire Traps, Pitfall Traps, and Dummy Traps. These cannot be deployed in the enemy's deployment zone, within 3" of another Trap Marker or an Objective Marker, or within an enemy model's Control Zone. When an enemy model Moves within 1" of a Trap Marker, they immediately stop Moving and flip the Trap Marker; after resolving its effects, the model's Activation immediately ends. Monster, War Beast, Swarm and Chariot models are completely unaffected by Trap Markers, and will instead simply remove them from play if they Move within 1" of them. Once a Trap has been resolved and any affected models are no longer affected, remove that Trap Marker from play. The effects of each Trap Marker are explained below:
Tripwire Trap - When this is revealed, Baldo's player rolls a D6. On a 2+, the model that revealed the trap suffers a Strength 2 hit and is placed Prone. Cavalry models that reveal a trap are only affected on a 4+. However, they will also be Knocked Flying in addition to the other effects.
Pitfall Trap - When this is revealed, Baldo's player rolls a D6. On a 2+, the model that revealed the trap falls into the hole. Whilst in a hole, a model may not Move and always counts as Trapped. If a model begins its Move in a hole they must roll a D6; on a 4+, the model clambers out of the hole and their Move immediately ends. Cavalry models that reveal a trap are only affected on a 4+. However, they will also be Knocked Flying in addition to the other effects.
Snare Trap - When this is revealed, Baldo's player rolls a D6. On a 2+, the model that revealed the trap suffers a Strength 1 hit, is placed Prone and is now caught in the Snare Trap. A model caught in a Snare Trap cannot Activate and will always count as Trapped. During the End Phase, a model caught in a Snare Trap must roll a D6; if the roll is equal to or less than their Strength, then they are freed from the Snare Trap. Cavalry models that reveal a trap are only affected on a 4+. However, they will also be Knocked Flying in addition to the other effects.
Dummy Trap - When this is revealed, the Activation of the model that revealed the Trap Marker immediately ends. There are no additional effects.

additional_rules.name: Barliman Butterbur, At Your Service
additional_rules.description: If Barliman finishes his Move in base contact with a friendly Fellowship model, he may spend a Will point to roll a D6. On a 4+, that friendly model regains a lost Wound.

additional_rules.name: Well fed, and ready to fight
additional_rules.description: Friendly Fellowship models within 6" of Barliman count as having the Dominant (2) special rule.

additional_rules.name: Deep-rooted Hatred
additional_rules.description: Must re-roll failed To Wound rolls against Orc, Uruk-hai, Goblin or Isengard models. Additionally, he must always charge these types of models if able to do so.

additional_rules.name: Bludgeon
additional_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the target is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

additional_rules.name: Skin-changer
additional_rules.description: At the start of his Activation, Beorn can change his form from Man to Bear. If he does, place the Bear model in base contact with the Man model, and then remove the Man model from play. If there is no space to place the Bear model, then Beorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Beorn the Bear may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging, in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Bear model to determine whether Beorn can Charge. Once Beorn has transformed, he uses the Beorn the Bear profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

additional_rules.name: Skin-changer
additional_rules.description: At the start of his Activation, Beorn can change his form from Bear to Man. If he does, place the Man model in base contact with the Bear model, and then remove the Bear model from play. If there is no space to place the Man model, then Beorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Beorn may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging, in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Man model to determine whether Beorn can Charge. Once Beorn has transformed, he uses the Beorn profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

additional_rules.name: Berserk
additional_rules.description: When Beorn the Bear begins his Activation, he must check to see if he can Charge an enemy model. If he can then he may not change form during this Activation and he must Charge an enemy model if possible. Additionally, Beorn the Bear may not benefit from the Heroic Actions of other friendly models, with the exception of friendly Bear models, and friendly models may not benefit from the Heroic Actions or Stand Fast of Beorn unless they have the Beorning keyword.

additional_rules.name: Crushing Strength
additional_rules.description: If Beorn wins a Duel Roll he can choose to use this Brutal Power Attack. If he does, choose a single enemy model involved in the Combat. The chosen model immediately suffers a Strength 10 hit. If the To Wound Roll is successful (even if the Wound is prevented), the model immediately suffers another Strength 10 hit, and so on until either Beorn fails a To Wound Roll, or the chosen model is slain and removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Followers of the Bear
additional_rules.description: This model treats friendly Bear models as a banner.

options.name: Swap hand-and-a-half weapon for great bow

additional_rules.name: Mithril Coat
additional_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Bilbo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

additional_rules.name: Sting
additional_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Bilbo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

additional_rules.name: Slip Away
additional_rules.description: Whilst wearing the One Ring and Invisible, enemy models Engaged in Combat with Bilbo must halve their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: Official Meals
additional_rules.description: Fellowship models treat Bill as a banner.

additional_rules.name: Second Breakfast
additional_rules.description: A Fellowship model who ends their Activation in base contact with Bill can roll a D6. On a 5+, they may restore 1 point of Might, Will or Fate spent earlier in the battle. Only one model can use this rule each turn.

additional_rules.name: Only a Pony
additional_rules.description: Bill never provides a Stand Fast. However, he can benefit from any Fellowship hero's Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: Naturally Unhasty
additional_rules.description: Birchseed gets a free Heroic Move in the Move Phase of any turn in which the opposing player won Priority and chose to have Priority themselves that turn.

additional_rules.name: Bludgeon
additional_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the target is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

additional_rules.name: Horn of Gondor
additional_rules.description: A war horn, where if Boromir is outnumbered in a Combat, you may ask your opponent to choose one of their models involved, who must take a Courage test. If they fail, Boromir wins the Duel roll.

additional_rules.name: Protect the little ones!
additional_rules.description: Whilst within 3" of friendly Fellowship Hobbit models, Boromir gains Fearless, and may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Bludgeon
additional_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the target is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

additional_rules.name: Get out of my fields!
additional_rules.description: Whilst within range of an Objective Marker, Farmer Maggot does not suffer the -1 penalty to his Duel rolls for using a two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: Pitchfork
additional_rules.description: A Pitchfork can either be used as a spear or a two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: "This is our Country"
additional_rules.description: Friendly Hobbit models within 3" of Farmer Cotton may re-roll any rolls of a 1 when making a Duel Roll.

additional_rules.name: High Spirits
additional_rules.description: Whenever a friendly Hobbit model within 6" of Folco spends a Might Point, they may roll a D6. On a natural 6, the Might Point spent is free and does not reduce the model's store of Might.

additional_rules.name: A Helpful Sort
additional_rules.description: If Folco is within 3" of Frodo, then Frodo can spend Folco's Will Points to declare a Heroic Move instead of using one of his own Might Points.

additional_rules.name: Live to fight another day
additional_rules.description: If Fredegar attempts to Charge an enemy model with the Terror special rule and fails the Courage Test, then Fredegar may still Move as normal; however, he may not Charge any model that turn.

additional_rules.name: Mithril Coat
additional_rules.description: A piece of Mithril armour, additionally Frodo may re-roll Fate rolls of a 1.

additional_rules.name: Sting
additional_rules.description: An Elven hand weapon, Frodo gains +1 Strength when making strikes with Sting.

additional_rules.name: Mithril Coat
additional_rules.description: Mithril armour. Additionally, the wearer may re-roll Fate Rolls of a 1.

additional_rules.name: "It will never really heal!"
additional_rules.description: Frodo may never Charge enemy models under any circumstances. Additionally, Frodo may never make Strikes if his side wins a Combat.

additional_rules.name: Home is the Hero
additional_rules.description: Friendly Hobbit models treat Frodo as a banner with a range of 6".

additional_rules.name: Nenya
additional_rules.description: Galadriel may re-roll any failed Fate rolls.

additional_rules.name: The Light of Earendil
additional_rules.description: At any point during her Activation, Galadriel can roll a D6. On a 3+, she counts as having cast the Blinding Light Magical Power. This does not prevent her from casting another Magical Power during her Activation.

additional_rules.name: The Lady of Lorien
additional_rules.description: Galadriel gains a free Will point at the start of each turn. If it is not spent by the end of the turn, then it is lost.

additional_rules.name: War Aspect
additional_rules.description: Enemies within 6" of Galadriel suffer a -1 penalty to any Courage tests. Additionally, Galadriel never counts as Unarmed.

additional_rules.name: "Go back to the void, from whence you came!"
additional_rules.description: Galadriel may target any enemy with Banishment as if it were a Spirit model, though non-Spirit models targeted will gain an extra free Will point to their Resist test. Once per game instead of casting a Magical Power, as long as she has at least 1 Will point, she may choose an enemy within 6", who immediately suffers D3 Wounds. After doing this, her Will points becomes 0, she is placed Prone, and no longer benefits from her The Lady of Lorien or War Aspect special rules (and thus becomes Unarmed).

additional_rules.name: Glamdring
additional_rules.description: Elven hand-and-a-half weapon. Gandalf's strength is 5 when making strikes with Glamdring.

additional_rules.name: Narya
additional_rules.description: Gandalf may re-roll any failed Fate rolls.

additional_rules.name: Forest Stalker
additional_rules.description: Whenever a friendly Druadan model within 6" of Ghan-buri-Ghan that is within a piece of woodland terrain suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On the roll of a natural 6, the Wound is ignored.

additional_rules.name: Axes of the Dwarves!
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of a Combat, Gimli can choose either his two-handed axe, or an axe in each hand which gives him an Attack value of 3.

additional_rules.name: "I myself am sitting pretty on 43"
additional_rules.description: If Gimli has fewer kills than Legolas, he gets +1 bonus on To Wound rolls when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: River-daughter
additional_rules.description: Goldberry treats all kinds of terrain as Open Ground and always treats the result of any Climb, Leap, Jump and Swim Tests as a 6. Goldberry cannot be targeted by any abilities, special rules, Magical Powers, Brutal Power Attacks or shooting attacks, either friendly or enemy. This means that any Magical Powers that would target Goldberry will automatically be resisted, even if they would target multiple models. If Goldberry is hit by a missile weapon as a result of a failed In The Way Test, the shot will automatically disappear and have no effect. Goldberry does not have a Control Zone. Enemy models cannot Move into base contact with Goldberry for any reason, unless Goldberry's controlling player explicitly allows it. If a model would be forced into base contact with Goldberry, then they will stop just before moving into base contact. Goldberry may Charge enemy models as normal, and her side will automatically win any Combat that Goldberry is involved in; however, when they do, friendly models may not make Strikes in that Combat. Goldberry may never carry Objectives under any circumstances and may never be chosen in Scenarios that require a player to choose a specific Hero model.

additional_rules.name: Goldberry is waiting
additional_rules.description: Goldberry may only be included in your Army if it includes Tom Bombadil. Goldberry must give up a Will Point during the End Phase of any turn in which she was Engaged in Combat. Should Goldberry be reduced to 0 Will Points, or if there are no friendly models on the board other than herself and/or Tom Bombadil, then she will simply wander off back to her homestead. Remove Goldberry as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Sing a Jolly Song (Goldberry)
additional_rules.description:
At any point during her Activation, Goldberry may spend a Will Point to sing one of the songs listed below to gain the relevant effect. Goldberry may sing any number of these songs during her Activation, and may sing each of these songs as many times as she wishes during her Activation unless otherwise stated. Every time Goldberry sings a song it will cost her a Will Point.
"Supper is Ready" - Choose a friendly model within 6" of Goldberry. The chosen model immediately regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battle. A model may only be chosen by this song once per turn.
"Have Peace Now" - Choose an enemy model within 6" of Goldberry. The chosen model may not be Activated during their player's Activation Phase this turn, but may otherwise act normally in all other Phases. This song may only be sung once per turn.
"Heed no Nightly Noises" - Choose a friendly model within 6" of Goldberry. Until the end of the turn, the chosen model automatically passes any Courage Tests it is required to take. Additionally, if the chosen model Charges an enemy model, the chosen model will increase their Fight Value by 1 until the End Phase of the turn. A model may only be chosen by this song once per turn.

additional_rules.name: Skin-changer
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of his Activation, Grimbeorn can change his form from Man to Bear. If he does, place the Bear model in base contact with the Man model, and then remove the Man model from play. If there is no space to place the Bear model, then Grimbeorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Grimbeorn the Bear may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Bear model to determine whether Grimbeorn can Charge. Once Grimbeorn has transformed, he uses the Grimbeorn the Bear profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

additional_rules.name: Leader of the Beornings
additional_rules.description: Only Beorning models can benefit from Grimbeorn's Heroic Actions or Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: Skin-changer
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of his Activation, Grimbeorn the Bear can change his form from Bear to Man. If he does, place the Man model in base contact with the Bear model, and then remove the Bear model from play. If there is no space to place the Man model, then Grimbeorn cannot transform. Once he has transformed, Grimbeorn may continue his Activation as normal, including Charging in which case check the Line of Sight from the newly placed Man model to determine whether Grimbeorn can Charge. Once Grimbeorn has transformed, he uses the Grimbeorn profile - though his Wounds, Might, Will and Fate Points remain the same between both profiles.

additional_rules.name: Leader of the Beornings
additional_rules.description: Only Beorning models can benefit from Grimbeorn's Heroic Actions or Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: Crushing Strength
additional_rules.description: If Grimbeorn wins a Duel Roll he can choose to use this Brutal Power Attack. If he does, choose a single enemy model involved in the Combat. The chosen model immediately suffers a Strength 10 hit. If the To Wound Roll is successful (even if the Wound is prevented), the model immediately suffers another Strength 10 hit, and so on until either Grimbeorn fails a To Wound Roll, or the chosen model is slain and removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Loyal Hounds
additional_rules.description: Grip, Fang and Wolf will always use Farmer Maggot's Courage value whilst he is alive on the battlefield. Additionally, they treat Farmer Maggot as a banner with range 6", and may re-roll failed To Wound rolls whilst within 6" of him.

additional_rules.name: The Windlord
additional_rules.description: Only Eagle and Wizard models may benefit from Gwaihir's Stand Fast or benefit from his Heroic Actions.

additional_rules.name: Leave my Flowers Alone!
additional_rules.description: At the start of the game after deployments, Hamfast's player places three 25mm Flower Markers anywhere on the board. Models can Move over them but cannot end their move or back away onto them. Objects cannot be placed overlapping them. Friendly Hobbits re-roll failed To Wound rolls for Strikes and shooting whilst within 3" of a Flower Marker. Hamfast also gains +1 To Wound when making Strikes or shooting an enemy within 3" of a Flower Marker.

additional_rules.name: Head Shirriff
additional_rules.description: Holfoot, and any Hobbit Shirriffs (including Robin Smallburrow) within 3" of him, do not suffer the -1 penalty to their Duel Roll for using their hand-and-a-half weapon as a two-handed weapon.

additional_rules.name: "Final Count, 42"
additional_rules.description: If Legolas has fewer kills than Gimli, he gains +1 To Wound on shooting attacks.

additional_rules.name: Dead Shot
additional_rules.description: Legolas can make three shooting attacks during the Shoot Phase. He can still shoot whilst Engaged in Combat, and does not suffer the -1 penalty To Hit for Moving and Shooting, as long as he has the Infantry keyword. He can also shoot at models he in Engaged in Combat with, requiring no In The Way tests.

additional_rules.name: Pinpoint Shot
additional_rules.description: Legolas can make a single shot against an enemy Engaged in Combat with himself or a friendly model. If the To Hit roll is successful, he doesn't need to make any In The Way rolls.

additional_rules.name: Umbrella
additional_rules.description: If Lobelia wins a Combat, she may not make Strikes.

additional_rules.name: Furious Tirade
additional_rules.description: Enemy Warrior models from may not benefit from a Hero model's Stand Fast whilst within 6" of Lobelia.

additional_rules.name: A Stern Scolding
additional_rules.description: Once per turn during her Activation, Lobelia can spend a Will point, and choose an enemy model within 6" and Line of Sight. Roll a D6, and on a 2+, that model cannot Activate this turn. Also, their Attack is reduced to 1 in any Combat. Does not affect Monster, Chariot or War Beast models.

additional_rules.name: Family Rivalry
additional_rules.description: Lotho may not take part in any Heroic Actions declared by either Bilbo Baggins or Frodo Baggins.

additional_rules.name: Considerable Wealth
additional_rules.description:
Lotho may spend his Will Points to pay off models around him in the following ways:
At the start of a Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Lotho can spend a Will Point to use this ability. If he does, until the End Phase of the turn, friendly Hobbit models within 3" of Lotho gain a +1 bonus to their Fight Value.
At the start of a Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Lotho can spend a Will Point to use this ability. If he does, until the End Phase of the turn, friendly Ruffian models within 3" of Lotho count as having the Fearless special rule.
When an enemy model attempts to Charge Lotho, Lotho may spend a Will Point to use this ability. If he does, roll a D6. On a 2+, the enemy model stops 1" away from Lotho instead of Charging him and their Activation immediately ends.

additional_rules.name: For the Shire!
additional_rules.description: If Merry is within 3" of Boromir of Gondor, Merry may spend his Might points as if they were his own.

[the-free-peoples] meriadoc-brandybuck-c.profile: Meriadoc Brandybuck, Captain of the Shire
additional_text: Any Hobbit Militia in Merry's Warband upgraded to Battlin Brandybucks have Strength 3.
