additional_rules.name: Horn of the Riddermark
additional_rules.description: A war horn. Additionally, Merry gains the Fearless special rule.

[the-free-peoples] paladin-took-thain-of.profile: Paladin Took, Thain of the Shire
additional_text: Any Hobbit Archers in Paladin's Warband upgraded to Tookish Hunters may re-roll To Wounds of a 1 when making shooting attacks.

additional_rules.name: To me, Shire-folk!
additional_rules.description: Paladin's Stand Fast has a range of 12"; however, only friendly Hobbit models may benefit from Paladin's Stand Fast.

additional_rules.name: For Tuckborough!
additional_rules.description: Friendly Tookish Hunters within 6" of Paladin gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes.

additional_rules.name: For the Shire!
additional_rules.description: If Pippin is within 3" of Boromir of Gondor, Merry may spend his Might points as if they were his own.

[the-free-peoples] peregrin-took-captain.profile: Peregrin Took, Captain of the Shire
additional_text: Any Hobbit Archers in Pippin's Warband upgraded to Tookish Hunters may re-roll To Wounds of a 1 when making shooting attacks.

additional_rules.name: Against all odds
additional_rules.description: Pippin may re-roll any failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes against Hero or Monster models.

additional_rules.name: Sebastian
additional_rules.description: During a Combat, Radagast may roll an additional D6 in the Duel roll, and an additional Strike if he wins, with Strength 1. This additional Strike cannot be modified by Might.

additional_rules.name: Master of Birds
additional_rules.description: Radagast always has Line of Sight to any point on the battlefield. Friendly Eagle models within 12" of Radagast gain Resistant to Magic.

additional_rules.name: A Nose for Shortcuts
additional_rules.description: In Scenarios where you roll for Warbands to arrive, or ones where you roll to see which part of the board you deploy a Warband in (though not when rolling to choose deployment zones), you may choose the result instead of rolling, even if Robin is not on the battlefield. Robin may only use this special rule if his Warband only contains Hobbit Shirriffs.

additional_rules.name: If I were to marry anyone, it would've been her
additional_rules.description: Whilst Sam is within 3" of Rosie, he may re-roll any failed To Wound rolls when making strikes.

additional_rules.name: Sweet Maiden of the Golden Ale
additional_rules.description: Rosie is a banner of range 6" for friendly Hobbit models. She also counts as a banner towards Scenario Victory Points, as long as she is alive.

additional_rules.name: "Let him go or I'll have you, Longshanks!"
additional_rules.description: If Frodo is Engaged in a Fight within 6" of Sam, then Sam may call a Heroic Combat for free. If the action is successful, Sam must use the following move to join Frodo's combat, or move as close as possible to Frodo.

additional_rules.name: Frying Pan
additional_rules.description: If Sam wins a Duel Roll, he may choose to use his frying pan instead of making Strike. Choose one enemy Infantry model in the Combat (but not a Monster) and roll a D6. On a 4+, that model is stunned and cannot Move the following turn.

additional_rules.name: Sting
additional_rules.description: Elven hand weapon. This model gains a bonus of +1 Strength when making Strikes with Sting.

additional_rules.name: "There’s some good in this world, Mr Frodo, and it’s worth fighting for"
additional_rules.description: During the Declare Heroic Actions step of the Fight Phase, if Frodo and/or Rosie are Engaged in Combat and are within 6" of Sam, then Sam may declare a free Heroic Combat. If this Heroic Combat is successful, then Sam must use the following Move to join either Frodo’s or Rosie’s Combat, as chosen by Sam’s controlling player. If this is not possible, then Sam must Move as close as possible to either Frodo or Rosie. Sam cannot use this special rule if he is in the same Combat as either Frodo or Rosie.

additional_rules.name: Voice of Curunir
additional_rules.description: Saruman's Stand Fast! Range is 12", and affects Hero models.

additional_rules.name: Consuming Rivalry
additional_rules.description: Saruman may never benefit from a friendly Gandalf the Grey's Heroic Actions or targeted by his Magical Powers.

additional_rules.name: Lord of the Istari
additional_rules.description: At the start of each Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Saruman may choose an enemy within 6" and Line of Sight, which must take an Intelligence test. If failed, that model cannot Activate this turn.

additional_rules.name: "Serve the Master of the Precious"
additional_rules.description: Smeagol's Courage value is 5+ whilst within 6" of Frodo.

additional_rules.name: "Soft and quick and shadows we must be"
additional_rules.description: Smeagol does not halve his Move value when moving through Difficult Terrain. Additionally, if Frodo or Sam begin their Activation within 6" of Smeagol, they will also benefit from this special rule.

additional_rules.name: A Light in the Dark
additional_rules.description: The area within 6" of the Gatekeeper is always considered to be daylight. Additionally, enemy models cannot Charge friendly models if they can charge the Gatekeeper instead.

additional_rules.name: Gatekeeper
additional_rules.description: After Priority has been rolled, the Gatekeeper may spent a Will point and choose one enemy Infantry model within 6" and in Line of Sight, and roll a D6. On a 3+, that model cannot Move that during their Activation, but may perform any other action as normal. Does not affect Monster models.

additional_rules.name: Shattered Spirit
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Move Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions Step, Thrain must take an Intelligence Test. If the test is passed, Thrain acts normally during the turn. If the test is passed on a double (i.e., both dice show the same score) then until the end of the turn, Thrain increases his Attacks to 3, his Strength to 4, and gains the Fearless special rule. If the test is failed, then the opposing player controls Thrain as if he was one of their models, and will Activate Thrain during their own Activation Phase. Though he is being controlled by the opposing player, Thrain cannot be targeted with shooting attacks, Magical Powers or special rules that affect enemy models. Additionally, if Thrain was a Good model, then other Good models cannot make Strikes against him should they beat him in a Combat or make Shooting Attacks if he would be In The Way as with any other Good model.

additional_rules.name: Gandalf's Intervention
additional_rules.description: If when Thrain takes his Intelligence Test for his Shattered Spirit special rule he is within 3" of a friendly Gandalf the Grey, then he may alter a single dice rolled as part of his Intelligence Test by 1, either up or down. If after this alteration the score of the Intelligence Test is a double, then Thrain may gain the benefits of rolling a double as described in his Shattered Spirit special rule.

additional_rules.name: Tom is Master
additional_rules.description: Tom Bombadil treats all kinds of terrain as Open Ground and always treats the result of any Climb, Leap, Jump and Swim Tests as a 6. Tom cannot be targeted by any abilities, special rules, Magical Powers, Brutal Power Attacks or shooting attacks, either friendly or enemy. This means that any Magical Powers that would target Tom will automatically be resisted, even if they would target multiple models. If Tom is hit by a missile weapon as a result of a failed In The Way Test, the shot will automatically disappear and have no effect. Tom Bombadil does not have a Control Zone. Enemy models cannot Move into base contact with Tom for any reason, unless Tom's controlling player explicitly allows it. If a model would be forced into base contact with Tom, then they will stop just before moving into base contact. Tom may Charge enemy models as normal, and his side will automatically win any Combat that Tom is involved in; however, when they do, friendly models may not make Strikes in that Combat. Tom Bombadil may never carry Objectives under any circumstances, and may never be chosen in Scenarios that require a player to choose a specific Hero model.

additional_rules.name: Tom has his house to mind
additional_rules.description: Tom Bombadil must give up a Will Point during the End Phase of any turn in which he was Engaged in Combat. Should Tom Bombadil be reduced to 0 Will Points, or if there are no friendly models on the board other than himself and/or Goldberry, then he will simply wander off back to his homestead. Remove Tom Bombadil as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Sing a Jolly Song (Tom)
additional_rules.description:
At any point during his Activation, Tom may spend a Will Point to sing one of the songs listed below to gain the relevant effect. Tom may sing any number of these songs during his Activation, and may sing each of these songs as many times as he wishes during his Activation unless otherwise stated. Every time Tom sings a song it will cost his a Will Point.
"Hey! Come Merry Doll!" - Choose a friendly model within 6" of Tom Bombadil. The chosen model immediately regains a single Wound lost earlier in the battle. A model may only be chosen by this song once per turn.
"Hop along, my hearties!" - Until the end of the turn, friendly models that begin their Activation within 6" of Tom Bombadil may add 3" to their Move Value and will treat all areas of Difficult Terrain as Open Ground.
"Wake now my merry lads!" - Choose a friendly model within 6" of Tom Bombadil. The chosen model immediately recovers from the effects of any enemy Magical Powers currently cast upon them. Additionally, until the end of the turn, the chosen model cannot be chosen as the target of any enemy Magical Powers or special rules.
"Ring a ding dillo!" - Until the end of the turn, friendly models within 6" of Tom Bombadil automatically pass any Courage Tests they are required to take.
"Get out, you Wight!" - Choose an enemy Spirit model within 6" of Tom Bombadil. The chosen model immediately suffers a Wound. This song may only be sung once per turn.

additional_rules.name: Merry & Pippin
additional_rules.description: Can ride as passengers and not be targeted by enemy attacks and shooting. Treebeard gains Resistant to Magic if one of them remains mounted. May use their Throw Stones rule without a -1 penalty for moving - see pg.24 of Armies of LOTR book for full details.

additional_rules.name: Bludgeon
additional_rules.description: Choose one enemy model as a bludgeon, and another model as the target. Both suffer a S8 hit. If the target is slain, you may keep repeating this until the bludgeon is not slain (in which case that model is knocked Prone). The bludgeon cannot be a Monster, Chariot or War Beast. If the bludgeon is a Cavalry model, then the rider is picked up and separated from their mount.

[the-free-peoples] will-whitfoot-mayor-o.profile: Will Whitfoot, Mayor of Michel Delving

additional_rules.name: Mayor of Michel Delving
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of a Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions step, Will Whitfoot can spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, friendly Hobbit Warrior models within 3" of him gain a bonus of +1 to their Fight Value until the End Phase of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Orcish Halberd
additional_rules.description: Can be used as either a spear or two-handed weapon. Shank may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes against a Trapped model.

additional_rules.name: Loot the Bodies
additional_rules.description: When Shank or Wrot slay a model, roll a D6. On a natural 6, they have found a trinket. At the end of the game, as long as of them is alive, you gain a Victory Point for each trinket found, to a maximum of 5 points. Your total Victory Points can not exceed 20.

additional_rules.name: Call 'the Beast'
additional_rules.description: Shank may spend a Will point at the start of his activation. If the Snow Troll is within 6" not Engaged in Combat, it must Charge if possible, gains Fearless, and may re-roll failed To Wound rolls when making Strikes, until the end of this turn.

additional_rules.name: Horned Charge
additional_rules.description: During a turn in which a Snow Troll Charges, it gains a bonus of +1 Attack and +1 Fight value until the end of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Tasty Fingers
additional_rules.description: Whenever Wrot slays an enemy model in Combat, he may roll a D6. On a 4+, he immediately regains either a Wound or Fate point spent earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Loot the Bodies
additional_rules.description: When Shank or Wrot slay a model, roll a D6. On a natural 6, they have found a trinket. At the end of the game, as long as of them is alive, you gain a Victory Point for each trinket found, to a maximum of 5 points. Your total Victory Points can not exceed 20.

additional_rules.name: Dunlending Heritage
additional_rules.description: Friendly Dunland Warrior models within 6" of Freca gain a bonus of +1 to their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: Claim the Throne
additional_rules.description: If the enemy General is removed as a casualty whilst within 6" of Freca, then for the duration of the battle, friendly Dunland models treat Freca as a banner with range 6".

additional_rules.name: Dunlending Commander
additional_rules.description: Whilst alive on the battlefield, if you win the Priority roll and give Priority to your opponent, then friendly Dunlending Warrior models within 6" of General Targg may re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes, until the end of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Flaming Brand
additional_rules.description: A model with a Flaming Brand has the Terror (Cavalry) and Terror (Beast) special rules. Additionally, this model counts as 2 models rather than 1 when working out how many models are within range of an objective marker.

additional_rules.name: Traitor of Rohan
additional_rules.description: Lord Thorne may only include Rohirrim Traitors in his Warband.

additional_rules.name: Edoras Shall Fall
additional_rules.description: During the Fight phase, friendly Rohirrim Traitors within 6" of Lord Thorne gain a bonus of +1 to their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: Spear Mastery
additional_rules.description: This model may use its throwing spears as a normal spear during the Fight phase, as long as it hasn't made a shooting attack with it in the Move or Shoot phase.

additional_rules.name: The Usurper King
additional_rules.description: If Engaged in Combat with an enemy Hero, Wulf may re-roll a single D6 during the Duel roll. Additionally, Wulf must re-roll To Wound rolls of a natural 1 when making Strikes against an enemy hero.

additional_rules.name: Blinding Swarm
additional_rules.description: Enemy models Engaged in Combat with a Bat Swarm halve their Fight value.

additional_rules.name: Keep 'em for Later
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Duel Roll, they may choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base instead of making Strikes or using a Brutal Power Attack. The chosen model is stuffed into a bag and suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power; however, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will Points or be slain. If the model is still Paralysed at the end of the game, then they will count as slain and be removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Roast 'em slowly
additional_rules.description: Instead of making Strikes, if he is within 6" of a Campfire, Bert may choose a single enemy model involved in the Combat. The chosen model is then placed in base contact with the Campfire and is immediately Set Ablaze.

additional_rules.name: Keep 'em for Later
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Duel Roll, they may choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base instead of making Strikes or using a Brutal Power Attack. The chosen model is stuffed into a bag and suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power; however, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will Points or be slain. If the model is still Paralysed at the end of the game, then they will count as slain and be removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Mince 'em Fine
additional_rules.description: Instead of making Strikes, Bill may choose a single enemy model involved in the Combat. Bill and the chosen model both roll a D6 and add their respective Strength characteristics. If Bill scores higher after adding Strength characteristics, then the chosen model suffers a number of Wounds equal to the difference between the two scores.

additional_rules.name: Protect the Nest
additional_rules.description: At the beginning of the game, after both sides have deployed, you may place a single 25mm Nest Marker anywhere on the board. Whilst within 3" of a friendly Nest Marker, a Cave Drake has the Fearless special rule.

additional_rules.name: Cornered Beast
additional_rules.description: If a Cave Drake loses a Duel Roll and is Trapped, then after any Strikes have been made against it the Cave Drake will lash out. When a Cave Drake lashes out, any models (friend or foe) that were Engaged in Combat with it, or are within 1" of it, will immediately suffer a Strength 4 hit.

additional_rules.name: Gaping Maw
additional_rules.description: Instead of making Strikes, a Cave Drake may choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base that was involved in the same combat and roll a D6. On a 2+, the chosen model suffers a Wound and, if this Wound is not prevented, the model is swallowed whole and removed as a Casualty. If the Cave Drake slays a model with this Brutal Power Attack, they may immediately regain a Wound lost earlier in the battle.

additional_rules.name: Troll Chain
additional_rules.description: A throwing weapon with Strength 5 and range 3'.

additional_rules.name: Troll Spear
additional_rules.description: A spear that deals 2 Wounds rather than 1 when rolling a natural 6 on the To Wound roll when making Strikes. This rule only applies when this model is not Supporting.

additional_rules.name: Breathe Fire
additional_rules.description: Used as a shooting attack during the Shoot Phase; treat this as a bow with a range 12". On a hit, the model that is hit, and all models (friend or foe) within 2" of the hit model, will suffer a Strength 10 hit. Any model that suffers a Wound from this shooting attack which is not prevented is automatically slain. This is a fire-based attack.

additional_rules.name: Fly
additional_rules.description: The Dragon gains the Fly special rule and increases its Move Value to 12" whilst using the Fly special rule.

additional_rules.name: Superior Intellect
additional_rules.description: The Dragon automatically passes any Intelligence Tests it is required to take. Additionally, each time the Dragon spends a Might Point, roll a D6. On a 4+, the Might Point is free and does not reduce the Dragon's store of Might.

additional_rules.name: Tough Hide
additional_rules.description: Increases Wounds and Defence to 9 each.

additional_rules.name: Wyrmtongue
additional_rules.description: The Dragon gains a free Will Point at the start of each turn. If this free Will Point is not spent by the end of the turn, it is lost.

additional_rules.name: Master of the Dark Wild
additional_rules.description: Friendly Beast models within 12" of Druzhag may use his Courage or Intelligence values instead of their own when making a Courage Test or an Intelligence Test. Additionally, whenever Druzhag suffers a Wound, before any Fate Rolls are made, he may roll a D6. On a 2+, he may choose a single friendly Beast model within 2" to immediately suffer the Wound instead of him. Fate Rolls can then be made as normal.

additional_rules.name: Iron Fist
additional_rules.description: Durburz's Stand Fast range is 12" rather than 6".

additional_rules.name: Callous Leadership
additional_rules.description: Once per game, at the start of any Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions Step, Durburz can declare he is using this ability. Until the End Phase of the turn, friendly Goblin models within 6" of Durburz gain a bonus of +1 To Wound when making Strikes. However, any other friendly Goblin model within 6" that loses a Duel Roll (not including Supporting models) must roll a D6 after any Strikes have been made against them. On the roll of a 1, the model suffers a Wound.

additional_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
additional_rules.description: This model may Support as if it had a spear, with the exception that they can only Support another model with this special rule. A model Supporting whilst using this special rule cannot also use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

additional_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
additional_rules.description: This model may Support as if it had a spear, with the exception that they can only Support another model with this special rule. A model Supporting whilst using this special rule cannot also use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

additional_text: Gollum has strong, strangling fingers and so is never considered to be Unarmed - ever! If your opponent does not have a Ringbearer in their Army, then Gollum carries the One Ring.

additional_rules.name: The Precious
additional_rules.description: If your opponent's Army contains a Ringbearer, then when Gollum Moves, he must always Charge the enemy Ringbearer if possible. Additionally, if Gollum kills the enemy Ringbearer in Combat, then he will automatically regain the One Ring - from that point onwards he counts as having it as part of his Wargear.

additional_rules.name: Swap with Me
additional_rules.description: At the start of the Fight Phase, before the Declare Heroic Actions Step, Grinnah can choose a friendly Goblin model on a 25mm base within 3" and swap places with it. This does not count as Moving.

additional_rules.name: Chittering Hordes
additional_rules.description: This model may Support as if it had a spear, with the exception that they can only Support another model with this special rule. A model Supporting whilst using this special rule cannot also use a two-handed weapon in the same Combat.

additional_rules.name: Moria Goblin Drum
additional_rules.description: The Drum has 10 Defence, 3 Wounds, is a Heavy Object, can be shot at, is always on a 25mm base and must be deployed in base contact with one of its Moria Goblin Drummers. If, during the End Phase, an enemy model is in base contact with the Drum, and the only thing that model has done is Move this turn (e.g. no shooting, combat etc.), and that model was not affected by a Magical Power this turn, then it can remove the Drum from play.

additional_rules.name: Drums in the Deep
additional_rules.description:
For the Drum to be played, at least one Drummer must be in base contact with it, have not Moved that turn, and not be Engaged in Combat. Whilst the Drum is being played it has the following effects:

* Friendly Moria Goblin models gain a bonus of +1 to any Courage Tests they are required to take.
* Enemy models suffer a -1 penalty to any Courage Tests they are required to take.
* Friendly Moria Goblin models within 18" count as being in range of a banner.
* Whilst being played, the Moria Goblin Drum counts as a banner for the purpose of Victory Points.

additional_rules.name: Take up the Drum
additional_rules.description: If a Drummer is slain, then they may pass on their wargear to a friendly Moria Goblin Warrior within 1" of them. The chosen model becomes a Moria Goblin Drummer and exchanges their wargear for that of the slain model - replace the chosen model with the slain Moria Goblin Drummer.

additional_rules.name: Fiery Lash
additional_rules.description: Throwing weapon with Strength 7, range 8. If the target is not slain and is not immune to fire-based attacks, it is pulled into base contact with the Balrog. For Cavalry, the whole model is dragged in this way. If the model cannot be placed in base contact, then it is not moved at all. Also, if the target is pulled into contact with other enemy models, it is not Engaged in Combat with them, only the Balrog.

additional_rules.name: Goblin Mastery
additional_rules.description: Moria Goblin models within 6" automatically pass Courage tests they are required to make.

additional_rules.name: Flame of Udun
additional_rules.description: If an enemy is Wounded, and not slain at the end of a Combat, roll a D6. On 6, the model is Set Ablaze, unless they are immune to fire-based attacks.

additional_rules.name: Demon of the Ancient World
additional_rules.description: The Balrog may declare a Heroic Combat each turn for free. Special rules or wargear that would slay the Balrog instantly (such as a Morgul Blade) will only inflict half of the Balrog's starting Wounds rather than all of them.

additional_rules.name: Relentless Advance
additional_rules.description: The Goblin King may Move through friendly Goblin models when he Charges into Combat, though not when forced to Move by the effects of an enemy Magical Power or special rule. Each friendly Goblin model Moved through in this way immediately suffers a Strength 3 hit. The Goblin King may finish his Move overlapping friendly models, through any friendly models he finishes his Move overlapping will automatically be slain.

additional_rules.name: Goblin Projectile
additional_rules.description: During the Shoot Phase, if the Goblin King is in base contact with a friendly Goblin model and neither are Engaged in Combat, then the Goblin King can make a shooting attack - this has a range of 12" and counts as a throwing weapon. Remove the friendly Goblin model as a casualty, and then make the To Hit Roll and any In The Way Tests as normal. The shot is resolved at a Strength of 8, and any model that is hit will automatically be knocked Prone.

additional_rules.name: Blubbery Mass
additional_rules.description: Each time the Goblin King suffers a Wound, roll a D6. On a 3+ the Wound is prevented. Wounds caused by Magical Powers or Elven weapons in Combat ignore this special rule. Wounds caused by Elven missile weapons will cause the Goblin King to suffer a -1 penalty to this roll.

additional_rules.name: Immobile
additional_rules.description: The Goblin Scribe cannot Move, and will always count as Trapped should it lose a Duel Roll. Additionally, friendly models may carry the Goblin Scribe in which case it will count as a Heavy Object, and must always be put down after a model carrying it has finished its Move. In Scenarios where models Move onto the board, the Goblin Scribe may be carried on by friendly models.

additional_rules.name: Always more where they came from
additional_rules.description: "If the Goblin King declares a Heroic Move whilst within 6\" of the Goblin Scribe and chooses to call With Me, then it will affect all friendly models on the battlefield rather than just those within 6

additional_rules.name: Many Tentacles
additional_rules.description: At 3 Wounds or less, Attack value becomes 3.

additional_rules.name: Water Dweller
additional_rules.description: Whilst within any water, The Watcher is never slowed, can still Shoot, and always counts as rolling a 6 on the Swim Chart. Also increases Move value to 8" and gains Monstrous Charge.

additional_rules.name: From the Deep
additional_rules.description: Never part of another Hero's Warband and deploys in a special way. During each Priority, if you wish for The Watcher to arrive, roll a D6. On a 3+, place it anywhere on the board, but not in a way that will displace other models. The Watcher cannot Charge in a turn in which it arrives.

additional_rules.name: Grasping Tentacles
additional_rules.description: In the Shoot phase, The Watcher may make D6 shooting attacks, even in Engaged in Combat. These have Strength 3 and range 6", and never require In The Way rolls. It can still shoot whilst moving and never suffers the -1 penalty. Any target hit and not slain is placed in base contact with The Watcher. If the model cannot be placed in base contact, then it is not moved at all. Also, if the target is pulled into contact with other enemy models, it is not Engaged in Combat with them, only The Watcher.

additional_rules.name: Dragged to the Depths
additional_rules.description: If within 6" of water, select a single enemy involved in the Combat and roll a D6. On a 2+, the model suffers a Wound, and if not prevented, will be immediately slain. The Watcher is then removed from the battlefield and its controlling player must roll to see if it arrives again in the same manner as described in the From the Deep special rule.

additional_rules.name: Keep 'em for Later
additional_rules.description: If this model wins a Duel Roll, they may choose a single enemy model on a 25mm base instead of making Strikes or using a Brutal Power Attack. The chosen model is stuffed into a bag and suffers the effects of the Paralyse Magical Power; however, the effects will not immediately end should this model have no Will Points or be slain. If the model is still Paralysed at the end of the game, then they will count as slain and be removed as a casualty.

additional_rules.name: Lingering Cold
additional_rules.description: At the start of any Combat involving Tom, he may spend a Will Point to use this special rule. If he does, he may choose a single enemy model he is Engaged in Combat with. The chosen model immediately halves their Fight Value until the end of the turn.

additional_rules.name: Squash 'em into jelly
additional_rules.description: Instead of making Strikes, Tom may use this Brutal Power Attack. Each enemy model that was Engaged in Combat with Tom immediately suffers a Strength 6 hit and, if they survive, will be knocked Prone.
